44 bool AddWallet(const std::shared_ptr<CWallet>& wallet)
45 {
46  LOCK(cs_wallets);
47  assert(wallet);
48  std::vector<std::shared_ptr<CWallet>>::const_iterator i = std::find(vpwallets.begin(), vpwallets.end(), wallet);
49  if (i != vpwallets.end()) return false;
50  vpwallets.push_back(wallet);
51  return true;
52 }

54 bool RemoveWallet(const std::shared_ptr<CWallet>& wallet)
55 {
56  LOCK(cs_wallets);
57  assert(wallet);
58  std::vector<std::shared_ptr<CWallet>>::iterator i = std::find(vpwallets.begin(), vpwallets.end(), wallet);
59  if (i == vpwallets.end()) return false;
60  vpwallets.erase(i);
61  return true;
62 }

129 CPubKey CWallet::GenerateNewKey(WalletBatch &batch, bool internal)
130 {
131  assert(!IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS));
132  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet); // mapKeyMetadata
133  bool fCompressed = CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_COMPRPUBKEY); // default to compressed public keys if we want 0.6.0 wallets
134 
135  CKey secret;
136 
137  // Create new metadata
138  int64_t nCreationTime = GetTime();
139  CKeyMetadata metadata(nCreationTime);
140 
141  // use HD key derivation if HD was enabled during wallet creation
142  if (IsHDEnabled()) {
143  DeriveNewChildKey(batch, metadata, secret, (CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT) ? internal : false));
144  } else {
145  secret.MakeNewKey(fCompressed);
146  }
147 
148  // Compressed public keys were introduced in version 0.6.0
149  if (fCompressed) {
150  SetMinVersion(FEATURE_COMPRPUBKEY);
151  }
152 
153  CPubKey pubkey = secret.GetPubKey();
154  assert(secret.VerifyPubKey(pubkey));
155 
156  mapKeyMetadata[pubkey.GetID()] = metadata;
157  UpdateTimeFirstKey(nCreationTime);
158 
159  if (!AddKeyPubKeyWithDB(batch, secret, pubkey)) {
160  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": AddKey failed");
161  }
162  return pubkey;
163 }
164 
165 void CWallet::DeriveNewChildKey(WalletBatch &batch, CKeyMetadata& metadata, CKey& secret, bool internal)
166 {
167  // for now we use a fixed keypath scheme of m/0'/0'/k
168  CKey seed; //seed (256bit)
169  CExtKey masterKey; //hd master key
170  CExtKey accountKey; //key at m/0'
171  CExtKey chainChildKey; //key at m/0'/0' (external) or m/0'/1' (internal)
172  CExtKey childKey; //key at m/0'/0'/<n>'
173 
174  // try to get the seed
175  if (!GetKey(hdChain.seed_id, seed))
176  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": seed not found");
177 
178  masterKey.SetSeed(seed.begin(), seed.size());
179 
180  // derive m/0'
181  // use hardened derivation (child keys >= 0x80000000 are hardened after bip32)
182  masterKey.Derive(accountKey, BIP32_HARDENED_KEY_LIMIT);
183 
184  // derive m/0'/0' (external chain) OR m/0'/1' (internal chain)
185  assert(internal ? CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT) : true);
186  accountKey.Derive(chainChildKey, BIP32_HARDENED_KEY_LIMIT+(internal ? 1 : 0));
187 
188  // derive child key at next index, skip keys already known to the wallet
189  do {
190  // always derive hardened keys
191  // childIndex | BIP32_HARDENED_KEY_LIMIT = derive childIndex in hardened child-index-range
192  // example: 1 | BIP32_HARDENED_KEY_LIMIT == 0x80000001 == 2147483649
193  if (internal) {
194  chainChildKey.Derive(childKey, hdChain.nInternalChainCounter | BIP32_HARDENED_KEY_LIMIT);
195  metadata.hdKeypath = "m/0'/1'/" + std::to_string(hdChain.nInternalChainCounter) + "'";
196  hdChain.nInternalChainCounter++;
197  }
198  else {
199  chainChildKey.Derive(childKey, hdChain.nExternalChainCounter | BIP32_HARDENED_KEY_LIMIT);
200  metadata.hdKeypath = "m/0'/0'/" + std::to_string(hdChain.nExternalChainCounter) + "'";
201  hdChain.nExternalChainCounter++;
202  }
203  } while (HaveKey(childKey.key.GetPubKey().GetID()));
204  secret = childKey.key;
205  metadata.hd_seed_id = hdChain.seed_id;
206  // update the chain model in the database
207  if (!batch.WriteHDChain(hdChain))
208  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": Writing HD chain model failed");
209 }

211 bool CWallet::AddKeyPubKeyWithDB(WalletBatch &batch, const CKey& secret, const CPubKey &pubkey)
212 {
213  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet); // mapKeyMetadata
214 
215  // CCryptoKeyStore has no concept of wallet databases, but calls AddCryptedKey
216  // which is overridden below. To avoid flushes, the database handle is
217  // tunneled through to it.
218  bool needsDB = !encrypted_batch;
219  if (needsDB) {
220  encrypted_batch = &batch;
221  }
222  if (!CCryptoKeyStore::AddKeyPubKey(secret, pubkey)) {
223  if (needsDB) encrypted_batch = nullptr;
224  return false;
225  }
226  if (needsDB) encrypted_batch = nullptr;
227 
228  // check if we need to remove from watch-only
229  CScript script;
230  script = GetScriptForDestination(pubkey.GetID());
231  if (HaveWatchOnly(script)) {
232  RemoveWatchOnly(script);
233  }
234  script = GetScriptForRawPubKey(pubkey);
235  if (HaveWatchOnly(script)) {
236  RemoveWatchOnly(script);
237  }
238 
239  if (!IsCrypted()) {
240  return batch.WriteKey(pubkey,
241  secret.GetPrivKey(),
242  mapKeyMetadata[pubkey.GetID()]);
243  }
244  return true;
245 }
246 
247 bool CWallet::AddKeyPubKey(const CKey& secret, const CPubKey &pubkey)
248 {
249  WalletBatch batch(*database);
250  return CWallet::AddKeyPubKeyWithDB(batch, secret, pubkey);
251 }

253 bool CWallet::AddCryptedKey(const CPubKey &vchPubKey,

261  return encrypted_batch->WriteCryptedKey(vchPubKey,

268  }

294 void CWallet::UpdateTimeFirstKey(int64_t nCreateTime)
295 {
296  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
297  if (nCreateTime <= 1) {
298  // Cannot determine birthday information, so set the wallet birthday to
299  // the beginning of time.
300  nTimeFirstKey = 1;
301  } else if (!nTimeFirstKey || nCreateTime < nTimeFirstKey) {
302  nTimeFirstKey = nCreateTime;
303  }
304 }

313 bool CWallet::LoadCScript(const CScript& redeemScript)
314 {
315  /* A sanity check was added in pull #3843 to avoid adding redeemScripts
316  * that never can be redeemed. However, old wallets may still contain
317  * these. Do not add them to the wallet and warn. */
318  if (redeemScript.size() > MAX_SCRIPT_ELEMENT_SIZE)
319  {
320  std::string strAddr = EncodeDestination(CScriptID(redeemScript));
321  WalletLogPrintf("%s: Warning: This wallet contains a redeemScript of size %i which exceeds maximum size %i thus can never be redeemed. Do not use address %s.\n", __func__, redeemScript.size(), MAX_SCRIPT_ELEMENT_SIZE, strAddr);
322  return true;
323  }
324 
325  return CCryptoKeyStore::AddCScript(redeemScript);
326 }

362 bool CWallet::Unlock(const SecureString& strWalletPassphrase)
363 {
364  CCrypter crypter;
365  CKeyingMaterial _vMasterKey;
366 
367  {
368  LOCK(cs_wallet);
369  for (const MasterKeyMap::value_type& pMasterKey : mapMasterKeys)
370  {
371  if(!crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strWalletPassphrase, pMasterKey.second.vchSalt, pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations, pMasterKey.second.nDerivationMethod))
372  return false;
373  if (!crypter.Decrypt(pMasterKey.second.vchCryptedKey, _vMasterKey))
374  continue; // try another master key
375  if (CCryptoKeyStore::Unlock(_vMasterKey))
376  return true;
377  }
378  }
379  return false;
380 }
381 
382 bool CWallet::ChangeWalletPassphrase(const SecureString& strOldWalletPassphrase, const SecureString& strNewWalletPassphrase)
383 {
384  bool fWasLocked = IsLocked();
385 
386  {
387  LOCK(cs_wallet);
388  Lock();
389 
390  CCrypter crypter;
391  CKeyingMaterial _vMasterKey;
392  for (MasterKeyMap::value_type& pMasterKey : mapMasterKeys)
393  {
394  if(!crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strOldWalletPassphrase, pMasterKey.second.vchSalt, pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations, pMasterKey.second.nDerivationMethod))
395  return false;
396  if (!crypter.Decrypt(pMasterKey.second.vchCryptedKey, _vMasterKey))
397  return false;
398  if (CCryptoKeyStore::Unlock(_vMasterKey))
399  {
400  int64_t nStartTime = GetTimeMillis();
401  crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strNewWalletPassphrase, pMasterKey.second.vchSalt, pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations, pMasterKey.second.nDerivationMethod);
402  pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations = static_cast<unsigned int>(pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations * (100 / ((double)(GetTimeMillis() - nStartTime))));
403 
404  nStartTime = GetTimeMillis();
405  crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strNewWalletPassphrase, pMasterKey.second.vchSalt, pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations, pMasterKey.second.nDerivationMethod);
406  pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations = (pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations + static_cast<unsigned int>(pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations * 100 / ((double)(GetTimeMillis() - nStartTime)))) / 2;
407 
408  if (pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations < 25000)
409  pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations = 25000;
410 
411  WalletLogPrintf("Wallet passphrase changed to an nDeriveIterations of %i\n", pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations);
412 
413  if (!crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strNewWalletPassphrase, pMasterKey.second.vchSalt, pMasterKey.second.nDeriveIterations, pMasterKey.second.nDerivationMethod))
414  return false;
415  if (!crypter.Encrypt(_vMasterKey, pMasterKey.second.vchCryptedKey))
416  return false;
417  WalletBatch(*database).WriteMasterKey(pMasterKey.first, pMasterKey.second);
418  if (fWasLocked)
419  Lock();
420  return true;
421  }
422  }
423  }
424 
425  return false;
426 }

434 void CWallet::SetMinVersion(enum WalletFeature nVersion, WalletBatch* batch_in, bool fExplicit)
435 {
436  LOCK(cs_wallet); // nWalletVersion
437  if (nWalletVersion >= nVersion)
438  return;
439 
440  // when doing an explicit upgrade, if we pass the max version permitted, upgrade all the way
441  if (fExplicit && nVersion > nWalletMaxVersion)
442  nVersion = FEATURE_LATEST;
443 
444  nWalletVersion = nVersion;
445 
446  if (nVersion > nWalletMaxVersion)
447  nWalletMaxVersion = nVersion;
448 
449  {
450  WalletBatch* batch = batch_in ? batch_in : new WalletBatch(*database);
451  if (nWalletVersion > 40000)
452  batch->WriteMinVersion(nWalletVersion);
453  if (!batch_in)
454  delete batch;
455  }
456 }

470 std::set<uint256> CWallet::GetConflicts(const uint256& txid) const
471 {
472  std::set<uint256> result;
473  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
474 
475  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator it = mapWallet.find(txid);
476  if (it == mapWallet.end())
477  return result;
478  const CWalletTx& wtx = it->second;
479 
480  std::pair<TxSpends::const_iterator, TxSpends::const_iterator> range;
481 
482  for (const CTxIn& txin : wtx.tx->vin)
483  {
484  if (mapTxSpends.count(txin.prevout) <= 1)
485  continue; // No conflict if zero or one spends
486  range = mapTxSpends.equal_range(txin.prevout);
487  for (TxSpends::const_iterator _it = range.first; _it != range.second; ++_it)
488  result.insert(_it->second);
489  }
490  return result;
491 }

505 void CWallet::SyncMetaData(std::pair<TxSpends::iterator, TxSpends::iterator> range)
506 {
507  // We want all the wallet transactions in range to have the same metadata as
508  // the oldest (smallest nOrderPos).
509  // So: find smallest nOrderPos:
510 
511  int nMinOrderPos = std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
512  const CWalletTx* copyFrom = nullptr;
513  for (TxSpends::iterator it = range.first; it != range.second; ++it) {
514  const CWalletTx* wtx = &mapWallet.at(it->second);
515  if (wtx->nOrderPos < nMinOrderPos) {
516  nMinOrderPos = wtx->nOrderPos;
517  copyFrom = wtx;
518  }
519  }
520 
521  if (!copyFrom) {
522  return;
523  }
524 
525  // Now copy data from copyFrom to rest:
526  for (TxSpends::iterator it = range.first; it != range.second; ++it)
527  {
528  const uint256& hash = it->second;
529  CWalletTx* copyTo = &mapWallet.at(hash);
530  if (copyFrom == copyTo) continue;
531  assert(copyFrom && "Oldest wallet transaction in range assumed to have been found.");
532  if (!copyFrom->IsEquivalentTo(*copyTo)) continue;
533  copyTo->mapValue = copyFrom->mapValue;
534  copyTo->vOrderForm = copyFrom->vOrderForm;
535  // fTimeReceivedIsTxTime not copied on purpose
536  // nTimeReceived not copied on purpose
537  copyTo->nTimeSmart = copyFrom->nTimeSmart;
538  copyTo->fFromMe = copyFrom->fFromMe;
539  // nOrderPos not copied on purpose
540  // cached members not copied on purpose
541  }
542 }
543 
548 bool CWallet::IsSpent(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, const uint256& hash, unsigned int n) const
549 {
550  const COutPoint outpoint(hash, n);
551  std::pair<TxSpends::const_iterator, TxSpends::const_iterator> range;
552  range = mapTxSpends.equal_range(outpoint);
553 
554  for (TxSpends::const_iterator it = range.first; it != range.second; ++it)
555  {
556  const uint256& wtxid = it->second;
557  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator mit = mapWallet.find(wtxid);
558  if (mit != mapWallet.end()) {
559  int depth = mit->second.GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
560  if (depth > 0 || (depth == 0 && !mit->second.isAbandoned()))
561  return true; // Spent
562  }
563  }
564  return false;
565 }

579 void CWallet::AddToSpends(const uint256& wtxid)
580 {
581  auto it = mapWallet.find(wtxid);
582  assert(it != mapWallet.end());
583  CWalletTx& thisTx = it->second;
584  if (thisTx.IsCoinBase()) // Coinbases don't spend anything!
585  return;
586 
587  for (const CTxIn& txin : thisTx.tx->vin)
588  AddToSpends(txin.prevout, wtxid);
589 }

591 bool CWallet::EncryptWallet(const SecureString& strWalletPassphrase)
592 {
593  if (IsCrypted())
594  return false;
595 
596  CKeyingMaterial _vMasterKey;
597 
598  _vMasterKey.resize(WALLET_CRYPTO_KEY_SIZE);
599  GetStrongRandBytes(&_vMasterKey[0], WALLET_CRYPTO_KEY_SIZE);
600 
601  CMasterKey kMasterKey;
602 
603  kMasterKey.vchSalt.resize(WALLET_CRYPTO_SALT_SIZE);
604  GetStrongRandBytes(&kMasterKey.vchSalt[0], WALLET_CRYPTO_SALT_SIZE);
605 
606  CCrypter crypter;
607  int64_t nStartTime = GetTimeMillis();
608  crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strWalletPassphrase, kMasterKey.vchSalt, 25000, kMasterKey.nDerivationMethod);
609  kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations = static_cast<unsigned int>(2500000 / ((double)(GetTimeMillis() - nStartTime)));
610 
611  nStartTime = GetTimeMillis();
612  crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strWalletPassphrase, kMasterKey.vchSalt, kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations, kMasterKey.nDerivationMethod);
613  kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations = (kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations + static_cast<unsigned int>(kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations * 100 / ((double)(GetTimeMillis() - nStartTime)))) / 2;
614 
615  if (kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations < 25000)
616  kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations = 25000;
617 
618  WalletLogPrintf("Encrypting Wallet with an nDeriveIterations of %i\n", kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations);
619 
620  if (!crypter.SetKeyFromPassphrase(strWalletPassphrase, kMasterKey.vchSalt, kMasterKey.nDeriveIterations, kMasterKey.nDerivationMethod))
621  return false;
622  if (!crypter.Encrypt(_vMasterKey, kMasterKey.vchCryptedKey))
623  return false;
624 
625  {
626  LOCK(cs_wallet);
627  mapMasterKeys[++nMasterKeyMaxID] = kMasterKey;
628  assert(!encrypted_batch);
629  encrypted_batch = new WalletBatch(*database);
630  if (!encrypted_batch->TxnBegin()) {
631  delete encrypted_batch;
632  encrypted_batch = nullptr;
633  return false;
634  }
635  encrypted_batch->WriteMasterKey(nMasterKeyMaxID, kMasterKey);
636 
637  if (!EncryptKeys(_vMasterKey))
638  {
639  encrypted_batch->TxnAbort();
640  delete encrypted_batch;
641  encrypted_batch = nullptr;
642  // We now probably have half of our keys encrypted in memory, and half not...
643  // die and let the user reload the unencrypted wallet.
644  assert(false);
645  }
646 
647  // Encryption was introduced in version 0.4.0
648  SetMinVersion(FEATURE_WALLETCRYPT, encrypted_batch, true);
649 
650  if (!encrypted_batch->TxnCommit()) {
651  delete encrypted_batch;
652  encrypted_batch = nullptr;
653  // We now have keys encrypted in memory, but not on disk...
654  // die to avoid confusion and let the user reload the unencrypted wallet.
655  assert(false);
656  }
657 
658  delete encrypted_batch;
659  encrypted_batch = nullptr;
660 
661  Lock();
662  Unlock(strWalletPassphrase);
663 
664  // if we are using HD, replace the HD seed with a new one
665  if (IsHDEnabled()) {
666  SetHDSeed(GenerateNewSeed());
667  }
668 
669  NewKeyPool();
670  Lock();
671 
672  // Need to completely rewrite the wallet file; if we don't, bdb might keep
673  // bits of the unencrypted private key in slack space in the database file.
674  database->Rewrite();
675 
676  // BDB seems to have a bad habit of writing old data into
677  // slack space in .dat files; that is bad if the old data is
678  // unencrypted private keys. So:
679  database->ReloadDbEnv();
680 
681  }
682  NotifyStatusChanged(this);
683 
684  return true;
685 }
686 
687 DBErrors CWallet::ReorderTransactions()
688 {
689  LOCK(cs_wallet);
690  WalletBatch batch(*database);
691 
692  // Old wallets didn't have any defined order for transactions
693  // Probably a bad idea to change the output of this
694 
695  // First: get all CWalletTx into a sorted-by-time multimap.
696  typedef std::multimap<int64_t, CWalletTx*> TxItems;
697  TxItems txByTime;
698 
699  for (auto& entry : mapWallet)
700  {
701  CWalletTx* wtx = &entry.second;
702  txByTime.insert(std::make_pair(wtx->nTimeReceived, wtx));
703  }
704 
705  nOrderPosNext = 0;
706  std::vector<int64_t> nOrderPosOffsets;
707  for (TxItems::iterator it = txByTime.begin(); it != txByTime.end(); ++it)
708  {
709  CWalletTx *const pwtx = (*it).second;
710  int64_t& nOrderPos = pwtx->nOrderPos;
711 
712  if (nOrderPos == -1)
713  {
714  nOrderPos = nOrderPosNext++;
715  nOrderPosOffsets.push_back(nOrderPos);
716 
717  if (!batch.WriteTx(*pwtx))
718  return DBErrors::LOAD_FAIL;
719  }
720  else
721  {
722  int64_t nOrderPosOff = 0;
723  for (const int64_t& nOffsetStart : nOrderPosOffsets)
724  {
725  if (nOrderPos >= nOffsetStart)
726  ++nOrderPosOff;
727  }
728  nOrderPos += nOrderPosOff;
729  nOrderPosNext = std::max(nOrderPosNext, nOrderPos + 1);
730 
731  if (!nOrderPosOff)
732  continue;
733 
734  // Since we're changing the order, write it back
735  if (!batch.WriteTx(*pwtx))
736  return DBErrors::LOAD_FAIL;
737  }
738  }
739  batch.WriteOrderPosNext(nOrderPosNext);
740 
741  return DBErrors::LOAD_OK;
742 }
743 
744 int64_t CWallet::IncOrderPosNext(WalletBatch *batch)
745 {
746  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet); // nOrderPosNext
747  int64_t nRet = nOrderPosNext++;
748  if (batch) {
749  batch->WriteOrderPosNext(nOrderPosNext);
750  } else {
751  WalletBatch(*database).WriteOrderPosNext(nOrderPosNext);
752  }
753  return nRet;
754 }
755 
756 void CWallet::MarkDirty()
757 {
758  {
759  LOCK(cs_wallet);
760  for (std::pair<const uint256, CWalletTx>& item : mapWallet)
761  item.second.MarkDirty();
762  }
763 }

765 bool CWallet::MarkReplaced(const uint256& originalHash, const uint256& newHash)
766 {
767  LOCK(cs_wallet);
768 
769  auto mi = mapWallet.find(originalHash);
770 
771  // There is a bug if MarkReplaced is not called on an existing wallet transaction.
772  assert(mi != mapWallet.end());
773 
774  CWalletTx& wtx = (*mi).second;
775 
776  // Ensure for now that we're not overwriting data
777  assert(wtx.mapValue.count("replaced_by_txid") == 0);
778 
779  wtx.mapValue["replaced_by_txid"] = newHash.ToString();
780 
781  WalletBatch batch(*database, "r+");
782 
783  bool success = true;
784  if (!batch.WriteTx(wtx)) {
785  WalletLogPrintf("%s: Updating batch tx %s failed\n", __func__, wtx.GetHash().ToString());
786  success = false;
787  }
788 
789  NotifyTransactionChanged(this, originalHash, CT_UPDATED);
790 
791  return success;
792 }
793 
794 bool CWallet::AddToWallet(const CWalletTx& wtxIn, bool fFlushOnClose)
795 {
796  LOCK(cs_wallet);
797 
798  WalletBatch batch(*database, "r+", fFlushOnClose);
799 
800  uint256 hash = wtxIn.GetHash();
801 
802  // Inserts only if not already there, returns tx inserted or tx found
803  std::pair<std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::iterator, bool> ret = mapWallet.insert(std::make_pair(hash, wtxIn));
804  CWalletTx& wtx = (*ret.first).second;
805  wtx.BindWallet(this);
806  bool fInsertedNew = ret.second;
807  if (fInsertedNew) {
808  wtx.nTimeReceived = GetAdjustedTime();
809  wtx.nOrderPos = IncOrderPosNext(&batch);
810  wtx.m_it_wtxOrdered = wtxOrdered.insert(std::make_pair(wtx.nOrderPos, &wtx));
811  wtx.nTimeSmart = ComputeTimeSmart(wtx);
812  AddToSpends(hash);
813  }
814 
815  bool fUpdated = false;
816  if (!fInsertedNew)
817  {
818  // Merge
819  if (!wtxIn.hashUnset() && wtxIn.hashBlock != wtx.hashBlock)
820  {
821  wtx.hashBlock = wtxIn.hashBlock;
822  fUpdated = true;
823  }
824  // If no longer abandoned, update
825  if (wtxIn.hashBlock.IsNull() && wtx.isAbandoned())
826  {
827  wtx.hashBlock = wtxIn.hashBlock;
828  fUpdated = true;
829  }
830  if (wtxIn.nIndex != -1 && (wtxIn.nIndex != wtx.nIndex))
831  {
832  wtx.nIndex = wtxIn.nIndex;
833  fUpdated = true;
834  }
835  if (wtxIn.fFromMe && wtxIn.fFromMe != wtx.fFromMe)
836  {
837  wtx.fFromMe = wtxIn.fFromMe;
838  fUpdated = true;
839  }
840  // If we have a witness-stripped version of this transaction, and we
841  // see a new version with a witness, then we must be upgrading a pre-segwit
842  // wallet. Store the new version of the transaction with the witness,
843  // as the stripped-version must be invalid.
844  // TODO: Store all versions of the transaction, instead of just one.
845  if (wtxIn.tx->HasWitness() && !wtx.tx->HasWitness()) {
846  wtx.SetTx(wtxIn.tx);
847  fUpdated = true;
848  }
849  }
850 
852  WalletLogPrintf("AddToWallet %s %s%s\n", wtxIn.GetHash().ToString(), (fInsertedNew ? "new" : ""), (fUpdated ? "update" : ""));
853 
854  // Write to disk
855  if (fInsertedNew || fUpdated)
856  if (!batch.WriteTx(wtx))
857  return false;
858 
859  // Break debit/credit balance caches:
860  wtx.MarkDirty();
861 
862  // Notify UI of new or updated transaction
863  NotifyTransactionChanged(this, hash, fInsertedNew ? CT_NEW : CT_UPDATED);
864 
865  // notify an external script when a wallet transaction comes in or is updated
866  std::string strCmd = gArgs.GetArg("-walletnotify", "");
867 
868  if (!strCmd.empty())
869  {
870  boost::replace_all(strCmd, "%s", wtxIn.GetHash().GetHex());
871  std::thread t(runCommand, strCmd);
872  t.detach(); // thread runs free
873  }
874 
875  return true;
876 }
877 
878 void CWallet::LoadToWallet(const CWalletTx& wtxIn)
879 {
880  uint256 hash = wtxIn.GetHash();
881  const auto& ins = mapWallet.emplace(hash, wtxIn);
882  CWalletTx& wtx = ins.first->second;
883  wtx.BindWallet(this);
884  if (/* insertion took place */ ins.second) {
885  wtx.m_it_wtxOrdered = wtxOrdered.insert(std::make_pair(wtx.nOrderPos, &wtx));
886  }
887  AddToSpends(hash);
888  for (const CTxIn& txin : wtx.tx->vin) {
889  auto it = mapWallet.find(txin.prevout.hash);
890  if (it != mapWallet.end()) {
891  CWalletTx& prevtx = it->second;
892  if (prevtx.nIndex == -1 && !prevtx.hashUnset()) {
893  MarkConflicted(prevtx.hashBlock, wtx.GetHash());
894  }
895  }
896  }
897 }
898 
899 bool CWallet::AddToWalletIfInvolvingMe(const CTransactionRef& ptx, const CBlockIndex* pIndex, int posInBlock, bool fUpdate)
900 {
901  const CTransaction& tx = *ptx;
902  {
903  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
904 
905  if (pIndex != nullptr) {
906  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
907  std::pair<TxSpends::const_iterator, TxSpends::const_iterator> range = mapTxSpends.equal_range(txin.prevout);
908  while (range.first != range.second) {
909  if (range.first->second != tx.GetHash()) {
910  WalletLogPrintf("Transaction %s (in block %s) conflicts with wallet transaction %s (both spend %s:%i)\n", tx.GetHash().ToString(), pIndex->GetBlockHash().ToString(), range.first->second.ToString(), range.first->first.hash.ToString(), range.first->first.n);
911  MarkConflicted(pIndex->GetBlockHash(), range.first->second);
912  }
913  range.first++;
914  }
915  }
916  }
917 
918  bool fExisted = mapWallet.count(tx.GetHash()) != 0;
919  if (fExisted && !fUpdate) return false;
920  if (fExisted || IsMine(tx) || IsFromMe(tx))
921  {
922  /* Check if any keys in the wallet keypool that were supposed to be unused
923  * have appeared in a new transaction. If so, remove those keys from the keypool.
924  * This can happen when restoring an old wallet backup that does not contain
925  * the mostly recently created transactions from newer versions of the wallet.
926  */
927 
928  // loop though all outputs
929  for (const CTxOut& txout: tx.vout) {
930  // extract addresses and check if they match with an unused keypool key
931  for (const auto& keyid : GetAffectedKeys(txout.scriptPubKey, *this)) {
932  std::map<CKeyID, int64_t>::const_iterator mi = m_pool_key_to_index.find(keyid);
933  if (mi != m_pool_key_to_index.end()) {
934  WalletLogPrintf("%s: Detected a used keypool key, mark all keypool key up to this key as used\n", __func__);
935  MarkReserveKeysAsUsed(mi->second);
936 
937  if (!TopUpKeyPool()) {
938  WalletLogPrintf("%s: Topping up keypool failed (locked wallet)\n", __func__);
939  }
940  }
941  }
942  }
943 
944  CWalletTx wtx(this, ptx);
945 
946  // Get merkle branch if transaction was found in a block
947  if (pIndex != nullptr)
948  wtx.SetMerkleBranch(pIndex, posInBlock);
949 
950  return AddToWallet(wtx, false);
951  }
952  }
953  return false;
954 }
955 
956 bool CWallet::TransactionCanBeAbandoned(const uint256& hashTx) const
957 {
958  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
959  LOCK(cs_wallet);
960  const CWalletTx* wtx = GetWalletTx(hashTx);
961  return wtx && !wtx->isAbandoned() && wtx->GetDepthInMainChain(*locked_chain) == 0 && !wtx->InMempool();
962 }

964 void CWallet::MarkInputsDirty(const CTransactionRef& tx)
965 {
966  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx->vin) {
967  auto it = mapWallet.find(txin.prevout.hash);
968  if (it != mapWallet.end()) {
969  it->second.MarkDirty();
970  }
971  }
972 }
973 
974 bool CWallet::AbandonTransaction(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, const uint256& hashTx)
975 {
976  auto locked_chain_recursive = chain().lock(); // Temporary. Removed in upcoming lock cleanup
977  LOCK(cs_wallet);
978 
979  WalletBatch batch(*database, "r+");
980 
981  std::set<uint256> todo;
982  std::set<uint256> done;
983 
984  // Can't mark abandoned if confirmed or in mempool
985  auto it = mapWallet.find(hashTx);
986  assert(it != mapWallet.end());
987  CWalletTx& origtx = it->second;
988  if (origtx.GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain) != 0 || origtx.InMempool()) {
989  return false;
990  }
991 
992  todo.insert(hashTx);
993 
994  while (!todo.empty()) {
995  uint256 now = *todo.begin();
996  todo.erase(now);
997  done.insert(now);
998  auto it = mapWallet.find(now);
999  assert(it != mapWallet.end());
1000  CWalletTx& wtx = it->second;
1001  int currentconfirm = wtx.GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
1002  // If the orig tx was not in block, none of its spends can be
1003  assert(currentconfirm <= 0);
1004  // if (currentconfirm < 0) {Tx and spends are already conflicted, no need to abandon}
1005  if (currentconfirm == 0 && !wtx.isAbandoned()) {
1006  // If the orig tx was not in block/mempool, none of its spends can be in mempool
1007  assert(!wtx.InMempool());
1008  wtx.nIndex = -1;
1009  wtx.setAbandoned();
1010  wtx.MarkDirty();
1011  batch.WriteTx(wtx);
1012  NotifyTransactionChanged(this, wtx.GetHash(), CT_UPDATED);
1013  // Iterate over all its outputs, and mark transactions in the wallet that spend them abandoned too
1014  TxSpends::const_iterator iter = mapTxSpends.lower_bound(COutPoint(now, 0));
1015  while (iter != mapTxSpends.end() && iter->first.hash == now) {
1016  if (!done.count(iter->second)) {
1017  todo.insert(iter->second);
1018  }
1019  iter++;
1020  }
1021  // If a transaction changes 'conflicted' state, that changes the balance
1022  // available of the outputs it spends. So force those to be recomputed
1023  MarkInputsDirty(wtx.tx);
1024  }
1025  }
1026 
1027  return true;
1028 }
1029 
1030 void CWallet::MarkConflicted(const uint256& hashBlock, const uint256& hashTx)
1031 {
1032  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1033  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1034 
1035  int conflictconfirms = 0;
1036  CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(hashBlock);
1037  if (pindex && chainActive.Contains(pindex)) {
1038  conflictconfirms = -(chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight + 1);
1039  }
1040  // If number of conflict confirms cannot be determined, this means
1041  // that the block is still unknown or not yet part of the main chain,
1042  // for example when loading the wallet during a reindex. Do nothing in that
1043  // case.
1044  if (conflictconfirms >= 0)
1045  return;
1046 
1047  // Do not flush the wallet here for performance reasons
1048  WalletBatch batch(*database, "r+", false);
1049 
1050  std::set<uint256> todo;
1051  std::set<uint256> done;
1052 
1053  todo.insert(hashTx);
1054 
1055  while (!todo.empty()) {
1056  uint256 now = *todo.begin();
1057  todo.erase(now);
1058  done.insert(now);
1059  auto it = mapWallet.find(now);
1060  assert(it != mapWallet.end());
1061  CWalletTx& wtx = it->second;
1062  int currentconfirm = wtx.GetDepthInMainChain(*locked_chain);
1063  if (conflictconfirms < currentconfirm) {
1064  // Block is 'more conflicted' than current confirm; update.
1065  // Mark transaction as conflicted with this block.
1066  wtx.nIndex = -1;
1067  wtx.hashBlock = hashBlock;
1068  wtx.MarkDirty();
1069  batch.WriteTx(wtx);
1070  // Iterate over all its outputs, and mark transactions in the wallet that spend them conflicted too
1071  TxSpends::const_iterator iter = mapTxSpends.lower_bound(COutPoint(now, 0));
1072  while (iter != mapTxSpends.end() && iter->first.hash == now) {
1073  if (!done.count(iter->second)) {
1074  todo.insert(iter->second);
1075  }
1076  iter++;
1077  }
1078  // If a transaction changes 'conflicted' state, that changes the balance
1079  // available of the outputs it spends. So force those to be recomputed
1080  MarkInputsDirty(wtx.tx);
1081  }
1082  }
1083 }
1084 
1085 void CWallet::SyncTransaction(const CTransactionRef& ptx, const CBlockIndex *pindex, int posInBlock, bool update_tx) {
1086  if (!AddToWalletIfInvolvingMe(ptx, pindex, posInBlock, update_tx))
1087  return; // Not one of ours
1088 
1089  // If a transaction changes 'conflicted' state, that changes the balance
1090  // available of the outputs it spends. So force those to be
1091  // recomputed, also:
1092  MarkInputsDirty(ptx);
1093 }

1114 void CWallet::BlockConnected(const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, const CBlockIndex *pindex, const std::vector<CTransactionRef>& vtxConflicted) {
1115  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1116  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1117  // TODO: Temporarily ensure that mempool removals are notified before
1118  // connected transactions. This shouldn't matter, but the abandoned
1119  // state of transactions in our wallet is currently cleared when we
1120  // receive another notification and there is a race condition where
1121  // notification of a connected conflict might cause an outside process
1122  // to abandon a transaction and then have it inadvertently cleared by
1123  // the notification that the conflicted transaction was evicted.
1124 
1125  for (const CTransactionRef& ptx : vtxConflicted) {
1126  SyncTransaction(ptx);
1127  TransactionRemovedFromMempool(ptx);
1128  }
1129  for (size_t i = 0; i < pblock->vtx.size(); i++) {
1130  SyncTransaction(pblock->vtx[i], pindex, i);
1131  TransactionRemovedFromMempool(pblock->vtx[i]);
1132  }
1133 
1134  m_last_block_processed = pindex;
1135 }
1136 
1137 void CWallet::BlockDisconnected(const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock) {
1138  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1139  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1140 
1141  for (const CTransactionRef& ptx : pblock->vtx) {
1142  SyncTransaction(ptx);
1143  }
1144 }

1148 void CWallet::BlockUntilSyncedToCurrentChain() {
1149  AssertLockNotHeld(cs_main);
1150  AssertLockNotHeld(cs_wallet);
1151 
1152  {
1153  // Skip the queue-draining stuff if we know we're caught up with
1154  // chainActive.Tip()...
1155  // We could also take cs_wallet here, and call m_last_block_processed
1156  // protected by cs_wallet instead of cs_main, but as long as we need
1157  // cs_main here anyway, it's easier to just call it cs_main-protected.
1158  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1159  const CBlockIndex* initialChainTip = chainActive.Tip();
1160 
1161  if (m_last_block_processed && m_last_block_processed->GetAncestor(initialChainTip->nHeight) == initialChainTip) {
1162  return;
1163  }
1164  }
1165 
1166  // ...otherwise put a callback in the validation interface queue and wait
1167  // for the queue to drain enough to execute it (indicating we are caught up
1168  // at least with the time we entered this function).
1169  SyncWithValidationInterfaceQueue();
1170 }

1173 isminetype CWallet::IsMine(const CTxIn &txin) const
1174 {
1175  {
1176  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1177  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator mi = mapWallet.find(txin.prevout.hash);
1178  if (mi != mapWallet.end())
1179  {
1180  const CWalletTx& prev = (*mi).second;
1181  if (txin.prevout.n < prev.tx->vout.size())
1182  return IsMine(prev.tx->vout[txin.prevout.n]);
1183  }
1184  }
1185  return ISMINE_NO;
1186 }

1188 // Note that this function doesn't distinguish between a 0-valued input,
1189 // and a not-"is mine" (according to the filter) input.
1190 CAmount CWallet::GetDebit(const CTxIn &txin, const isminefilter& filter) const
1191 {
1192  {
1193  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1194  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator mi = mapWallet.find(txin.prevout.hash);
1195  if (mi != mapWallet.end())
1196  {
1197  const CWalletTx& prev = (*mi).second;
1198  if (txin.prevout.n < prev.tx->vout.size())
1199  if (IsMine(prev.tx->vout[txin.prevout.n]) & filter)
1200  return prev.tx->vout[txin.prevout.n].nValue;
1201  }
1202  }
1203  return 0;
1204 }

1222 
1223 bool CWallet::IsChange(const CScript& script) const
1224 {
1225  // TODO: fix handling of 'change' outputs. The assumption is that any
1226  // payment to a script that is ours, but is not in the address book
1227  // is change. That assumption is likely to break when we implement multisignature
1228  // wallets that return change back into a multi-signature-protected address;
1229  // a better way of identifying which outputs are 'the send' and which are
1230  // 'the change' will need to be implemented (maybe extend CWalletTx to remember
1231  // which output, if any, was change).
1232  if (::IsMine(*this, script))
1233  {
1234  CTxDestination address;
1235  if (!ExtractDestination(script, address))
1236  return true;
1237 
1238  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1239  if (!mapAddressBook.count(address))
1240  return true;
1241  }
1242  return false;
1243 }

1246 {
1247  if (!MoneyRange(txout.nValue))
1248  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": value out of range");
1249  return (IsChange(txout) ? txout.nValue : 0);
1250 }

1256  return true;
1257  return false;

1265 CAmount CWallet::GetDebit(const CTransaction& tx, const isminefilter& filter) const
1266 {
1267  CAmount nDebit = 0;
1268  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin)
1269  {
1270  nDebit += GetDebit(txin, filter);
1271  if (!MoneyRange(nDebit))
1272  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": value out of range");
1273  }
1274  return nDebit;
1275 }
1276 
1277 bool CWallet::IsAllFromMe(const CTransaction& tx, const isminefilter& filter) const
1278 {
1279  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1280 
1281  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin)
1282  {
1283  auto mi = mapWallet.find(txin.prevout.hash);
1284  if (mi == mapWallet.end())
1285  return false; // any unknown inputs can't be from us
1286 
1287  const CWalletTx& prev = (*mi).second;
1288 
1289  if (txin.prevout.n >= prev.tx->vout.size())
1290  return false; // invalid input!
1291 
1292  if (!(IsMine(prev.tx->vout[txin.prevout.n]) & filter))
1293  return false;
1294  }
1295  return true;
1296 }

1302  {
1303  nCredit += GetCredit(txout, filter);
1304  if (!MoneyRange(nCredit))
1305  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": value out of range");
1306  }
1307  return nCredit;

1323 {

1330 CPubKey CWallet::DeriveNewSeed(const CKey& key)
1331 {
1332  int64_t nCreationTime = GetTime();
1333  CKeyMetadata metadata(nCreationTime);
1334 
1335  // calculate the seed
1336  CPubKey seed = key.GetPubKey();
1337  assert(key.VerifyPubKey(seed));
1338 
1339  // set the hd keypath to "s" -> Seed, refers the seed to itself
1340  metadata.hdKeypath = "s";
1341  metadata.hd_seed_id = seed.GetID();
1342 
1343  {
1344  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1345 
1346  // mem store the metadata
1347  mapKeyMetadata[seed.GetID()] = metadata;
1348 
1349  // write the key&metadata to the database
1350  if (!AddKeyPubKey(key, seed))
1351  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": AddKeyPubKey failed");
1352  }
1353 
1354  return seed;
1355 }

1364  newHdChain.nVersion = CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT) ? CHDChain::VERSION_HD_CHAIN_SPLIT : CHDChain::VERSION_HD_BASE;
1365  newHdChain.seed_id = seed.GetID();
1366  SetHDChain(newHdChain, false);
1367 }

1396 bool CWallet::SetWalletFlags(uint64_t overwriteFlags, bool memonly)
1397 {

1400  if (((overwriteFlags & g_known_wallet_flags) >> 32) ^ (overwriteFlags >> 32)) {
1401  // contains unknown non-tolerable wallet flags
1402  return false;
1403  }
1404  if (!memonly && !WalletBatch(*database).WriteWalletFlags(m_wallet_flags)) {

1406  }

1417 // Helper for producing a max-sized low-S low-R signature (eg 71 bytes)
1418 // or a max-sized low-S signature (e.g. 72 bytes) if use_max_sig is true
1419 bool CWallet::DummySignInput(CTxIn &tx_in, const CTxOut &txout, bool use_max_sig) const
1420 {
1421  // Fill in dummy signatures for fee calculation.
1422  const CScript& scriptPubKey = txout.scriptPubKey;
1423  SignatureData sigdata;
1424 
1425  if (!ProduceSignature(*this, use_max_sig ? DUMMY_MAXIMUM_SIGNATURE_CREATOR : DUMMY_SIGNATURE_CREATOR, scriptPubKey, sigdata)) {
1426  return false;
1427  }
1428  UpdateInput(tx_in, sigdata);
1429  return true;
1430 }
1431 
1432 // Helper for producing a bunch of max-sized low-S low-R signatures (eg 71 bytes)
1433 bool CWallet::DummySignTx(CMutableTransaction &txNew, const std::vector<CTxOut> &txouts, bool use_max_sig) const
1434 {
1435  // Fill in dummy signatures for fee calculation.
1436  int nIn = 0;
1437  for (const auto& txout : txouts)
1438  {
1439  if (!DummySignInput(txNew.vin[nIn], txout, use_max_sig)) {
1440  return false;
1441  }
1442 
1443  nIn++;
1444  }
1445  return true;
1446 }
1447 
1448 int64_t CalculateMaximumSignedTxSize(const CTransaction &tx, const CWallet *wallet, bool use_max_sig)
1449 {
1450  std::vector<CTxOut> txouts;
1451  // Look up the inputs. We should have already checked that this transaction
1452  // IsAllFromMe(ISMINE_SPENDABLE), so every input should already be in our
1453  // wallet, with a valid index into the vout array, and the ability to sign.
1454  for (const CTxIn& input : tx.vin) {
1455  const auto mi = wallet->mapWallet.find(input.prevout.hash);
1456  if (mi == wallet->mapWallet.end()) {
1457  return -1;
1458  }
1459  assert(input.prevout.n < mi->second.tx->vout.size());
1460  txouts.emplace_back(mi->second.tx->vout[input.prevout.n]);
1461  }
1462  return CalculateMaximumSignedTxSize(tx, wallet, txouts, use_max_sig);
1463 }
1464 
1465 // txouts needs to be in the order of tx.vin
1466 int64_t CalculateMaximumSignedTxSize(const CTransaction &tx, const CWallet *wallet, const std::vector<CTxOut>& txouts, bool use_max_sig)
1467 {
1468  CMutableTransaction txNew(tx);
1469  if (!wallet->DummySignTx(txNew, txouts, use_max_sig)) {
1470  // This should never happen, because IsAllFromMe(ISMINE_SPENDABLE)
1471  // implies that we can sign for every input.
1472  return -1;
1473  }
1474  return GetVirtualTransactionSize(txNew);
1475 }
1476 
1477 int CalculateMaximumSignedInputSize(const CTxOut& txout, const CWallet* wallet, bool use_max_sig)
1478 {
1479  CMutableTransaction txn;
1480  txn.vin.push_back(CTxIn(COutPoint()));
1481  if (!wallet->DummySignInput(txn.vin[0], txout, use_max_sig)) {
1482  return -1;
1483  }
1484  return GetVirtualTransactionInputSize(txn.vin[0]);
1485 }
1486 
1487 void CWalletTx::GetAmounts(std::list<COutputEntry>& listReceived,
1488  std::list<COutputEntry>& listSent, CAmount& nFee, const isminefilter& filter) const
1489 {
1490  nFee = 0;
1491  listReceived.clear();
1492  listSent.clear();
1493 
1494  // Compute fee:
1495  CAmount nDebit = GetDebit(filter);
1496  if (nDebit > 0) // debit>0 means we signed/sent this transaction
1497  {
1498  CAmount nValueOut = tx->GetValueOut();
1499  nFee = nDebit - nValueOut;
1500  }
1501 
1502  // Sent/received.
1503  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx->vout.size(); ++i)
1504  {
1505  const CTxOut& txout = tx->vout[i];
1506  isminetype fIsMine = pwallet->IsMine(txout);
1507  // Only need to handle txouts if AT LEAST one of these is true:
1508  // 1) they debit from us (sent)
1509  // 2) the output is to us (received)
1510  if (nDebit > 0)
1511  {
1512  // Don't report 'change' txouts
1513  if (pwallet->IsChange(txout))
1514  continue;
1515  }
1516  else if (!(fIsMine & filter))
1517  continue;
1518 
1519  // In either case, we need to get the destination address
1520  CTxDestination address;
1521 
1522  if (!ExtractDestination(txout.scriptPubKey, address) && !txout.scriptPubKey.IsUnspendable())
1523  {
1524  pwallet->WalletLogPrintf("CWalletTx::GetAmounts: Unknown transaction type found, txid %s\n",
1525  this->GetHash().ToString());
1526  address = CNoDestination();
1527  }
1528 
1529  COutputEntry output = {address, txout.nValue, (int)i};
1530 
1531  // If we are debited by the transaction, add the output as a "sent" entry
1532  if (nDebit > 0)
1533  listSent.push_back(output);
1534 
1535  // If we are receiving the output, add it as a "received" entry
1536  if (fIsMine & filter)
1537  listReceived.push_back(output);
1538  }
1539 
1540 }
1541 
1550 int64_t CWallet::RescanFromTime(int64_t startTime, const WalletRescanReserver& reserver, bool update)
1551 {
1552  // Find starting block. May be null if nCreateTime is greater than the
1553  // highest blockchain timestamp, in which case there is nothing that needs
1554  // to be scanned.
1555  CBlockIndex* startBlock = nullptr;
1556  {
1557  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1558  startBlock = chainActive.FindEarliestAtLeast(startTime - TIMESTAMP_WINDOW);
1559  WalletLogPrintf("%s: Rescanning last %i blocks\n", __func__, startBlock ? chainActive.Height() - startBlock->nHeight + 1 : 0);
1560  }
1561 
1562  if (startBlock) {
1563  const CBlockIndex *failedBlock, *stop_block;
1564  // TODO: this should take into account failure by ScanResult::USER_ABORT
1565  if (ScanResult::FAILURE == ScanForWalletTransactions(startBlock, nullptr, reserver, failedBlock, stop_block, update)) {
1566  return failedBlock->GetBlockTimeMax() + TIMESTAMP_WINDOW + 1;
1567  }
1568  }
1569  return startTime;
1570 }
1571 
1592 CWallet::ScanResult CWallet::ScanForWalletTransactions(const CBlockIndex* const pindexStart, const CBlockIndex* const pindexStop, const WalletRescanReserver& reserver, const CBlockIndex*& failed_block, const CBlockIndex*& stop_block, bool fUpdate)
1593 {
1594  int64_t nNow = GetTime();
1595  const CChainParams& chainParams = Params();
1596 
1597  assert(reserver.isReserved());
1598  if (pindexStop) {
1599  assert(pindexStop->nHeight >= pindexStart->nHeight);
1600  }
1601 
1602  const CBlockIndex* pindex = pindexStart;
1603  failed_block = nullptr;
1604  stop_block = nullptr;
1605 
1606  if (pindex) WalletLogPrintf("Rescan started from block %d...\n", pindex->nHeight);
1607 
1608  {
1609  fAbortRescan = false;
1610  ShowProgress(strprintf("%s " + _("Rescanning..."), GetDisplayName()), 0); // show rescan progress in GUI as dialog or on splashscreen, if -rescan on startup
1611  CBlockIndex* tip = nullptr;
1612  double progress_begin;
1613  double progress_end;
1614  {
1615  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1616  progress_begin = GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), pindex);
1617  if (pindexStop == nullptr) {
1618  tip = chainActive.Tip();
1619  progress_end = GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), tip);
1620  } else {
1621  progress_end = GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), pindexStop);
1622  }
1623  }
1624  double progress_current = progress_begin;
1625  while (pindex && !fAbortRescan && !ShutdownRequested()) {
1626  if (pindex->nHeight % 100 == 0 && progress_end - progress_begin > 0.0) {
1627  ShowProgress(strprintf("%s " + _("Rescanning..."), GetDisplayName()), std::max(1, std::min(99, (int)((progress_current - progress_begin) / (progress_end - progress_begin) * 100))));
1628  }
1629  if (GetTime() >= nNow + 60) {
1630  nNow = GetTime();
1631  WalletLogPrintf("Still rescanning. At block %d. Progress=%f\n", pindex->nHeight, progress_current);
1632  }
1633 
1634  CBlock block;
1635  if (ReadBlockFromDisk(block, pindex, Params().GetConsensus())) {
1636  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1637  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1638  if (pindex && !chainActive.Contains(pindex)) {
1639  // Abort scan if current block is no longer active, to prevent
1640  // marking transactions as coming from the wrong block.
1641  failed_block = pindex;
1642  break;
1643  }
1644  for (size_t posInBlock = 0; posInBlock < block.vtx.size(); ++posInBlock) {
1645  SyncTransaction(block.vtx[posInBlock], pindex, posInBlock, fUpdate);
1646  }
1647  // scan succeeded, record block as most recent successfully scanned
1648  stop_block = pindex;
1649  } else {
1650  // could not scan block, keep scanning but record this block as the most recent failure
1651  failed_block = pindex;
1652  }
1653  if (pindex == pindexStop) {
1654  break;
1655  }
1656  {
1657  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1658  pindex = chainActive.Next(pindex);
1659  progress_current = GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), pindex);
1660  if (pindexStop == nullptr && tip != chainActive.Tip()) {
1661  tip = chainActive.Tip();
1662  // in case the tip has changed, update progress max
1663  progress_end = GuessVerificationProgress(chainParams.TxData(), tip);
1664  }
1665  }
1666  }
1667  ShowProgress(strprintf("%s " + _("Rescanning..."), GetDisplayName()), 100); // hide progress dialog in GUI
1668  if (pindex && fAbortRescan) {
1669  WalletLogPrintf("Rescan aborted at block %d. Progress=%f\n", pindex->nHeight, progress_current);
1670  return ScanResult::USER_ABORT;
1671  } else if (pindex && ShutdownRequested()) {
1672  WalletLogPrintf("Rescan interrupted by shutdown request at block %d. Progress=%f\n", pindex->nHeight, progress_current);
1673  return ScanResult::USER_ABORT;
1674  }
1675  }
1676  if (failed_block) {
1677  return ScanResult::FAILURE;
1678  } else {
1679  return ScanResult::SUCCESS;
1680  }
1681 }
1682 
1683 void CWallet::ReacceptWalletTransactions()
1684 {
1685  // If transactions aren't being broadcasted, don't let them into local mempool either
1686  if (!fBroadcastTransactions)
1687  return;
1688  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
1689  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1690  std::map<int64_t, CWalletTx*> mapSorted;
1691 
1692  // Sort pending wallet transactions based on their initial wallet insertion order
1693  for (std::pair<const uint256, CWalletTx>& item : mapWallet)
1694  {
1695  const uint256& wtxid = item.first;
1696  CWalletTx& wtx = item.second;
1697  assert(wtx.GetHash() == wtxid);
1698 
1699  int nDepth = wtx.GetDepthInMainChain(*locked_chain);
1700 
1701  if (!wtx.IsCoinBase() && (nDepth == 0 && !wtx.isAbandoned())) {
1702  mapSorted.insert(std::make_pair(wtx.nOrderPos, &wtx));
1703  }
1704  }
1705 
1706  // Try to add wallet transactions to memory pool
1707  for (const std::pair<const int64_t, CWalletTx*>& item : mapSorted) {
1708  CWalletTx& wtx = *(item.second);
1709  CValidationState state;
1710  wtx.AcceptToMemoryPool(*locked_chain, maxTxFee, state);
1711  }
1712 }
1713 
1714 bool CWalletTx::RelayWalletTransaction(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, CConnman* connman)
1715 {
1716  assert(pwallet->GetBroadcastTransactions());
1717  if (!IsCoinBase() && !isAbandoned() && GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain) == 0)
1718  {
1719  CValidationState state;
1720  /* GetDepthInMainChain already catches known conflicts. */
1721  if (InMempool() || AcceptToMemoryPool(locked_chain, maxTxFee, state)) {
1722  pwallet->WalletLogPrintf("Relaying wtx %s\n", GetHash().ToString());
1723  if (connman) {
1724  CInv inv(MSG_TX, GetHash());
1725  connman->ForEachNode([&inv](CNode* pnode)
1726  {
1727  pnode->PushInventory(inv);
1728  });
1729  return true;
1730  }
1731  }
1732  }
1733  return false;
1734 }

1736 std::set<uint256> CWalletTx::GetConflicts() const
1737 {
1738  std::set<uint256> result;
1739  if (pwallet != nullptr)
1740  {
1741  uint256 myHash = GetHash();
1742  result = pwallet->GetConflicts(myHash);
1743  result.erase(myHash);
1744  }
1745  return result;
1746 }

1748 CAmount CWalletTx::GetDebit(const isminefilter& filter) const
1749 {
1750  if (tx->vin.empty())
1751  return 0;
1752 
1753  CAmount debit = 0;
1754  if(filter & ISMINE_SPENDABLE)
1755  {
1756  if (fDebitCached)
1757  debit += nDebitCached;
1758  else
1759  {
1760  nDebitCached = pwallet->GetDebit(*tx, ISMINE_SPENDABLE);
1761  fDebitCached = true;
1762  debit += nDebitCached;
1763  }
1764  }
1765  if(filter & ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY)
1766  {
1767  if(fWatchDebitCached)
1768  debit += nWatchDebitCached;
1769  else
1770  {
1771  nWatchDebitCached = pwallet->GetDebit(*tx, ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY);
1772  fWatchDebitCached = true;
1773  debit += nWatchDebitCached;
1774  }
1775  }
1776  return debit;
1777 }

1779 CAmount CWalletTx::GetCredit(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, const isminefilter& filter) const
1780 {
1781  // Must wait until coinbase is safely deep enough in the chain before valuing it
1782  if (IsImmatureCoinBase(locked_chain))
1783  return 0;
1784 
1785  CAmount credit = 0;
1786  if (filter & ISMINE_SPENDABLE)
1787  {
1788  // GetBalance can assume transactions in mapWallet won't change
1789  if (fCreditCached)
1790  credit += nCreditCached;
1791  else
1792  {
1793  nCreditCached = pwallet->GetCredit(*tx, ISMINE_SPENDABLE);
1794  fCreditCached = true;
1795  credit += nCreditCached;
1796  }
1797  }
1798  if (filter & ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY)
1799  {
1800  if (fWatchCreditCached)
1801  credit += nWatchCreditCached;
1802  else
1803  {
1804  nWatchCreditCached = pwallet->GetCredit(*tx, ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY);
1805  fWatchCreditCached = true;
1806  credit += nWatchCreditCached;
1807  }
1808  }
1809  return credit;
1810 }

1812 CAmount CWalletTx::GetImmatureCredit(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, bool fUseCache) const
1813 {
1814  if (IsImmatureCoinBase(locked_chain) && IsInMainChain(locked_chain)) {
1815  if (fUseCache && fImmatureCreditCached)
1816  return nImmatureCreditCached;
1817  nImmatureCreditCached = pwallet->GetCredit(*tx, ISMINE_SPENDABLE);
1818  fImmatureCreditCached = true;
1819  return nImmatureCreditCached;
1820  }
1821 
1822  return 0;
1823 }

1825 CAmount CWalletTx::GetAvailableCredit(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, bool fUseCache, const isminefilter& filter) const
1826 {
1827  if (pwallet == nullptr)
1828  return 0;
1829 
1830  // Must wait until coinbase is safely deep enough in the chain before valuing it
1831  if (IsImmatureCoinBase(locked_chain))
1832  return 0;
1833 
1834  CAmount* cache = nullptr;
1835  bool* cache_used = nullptr;
1836 
1837  if (filter == ISMINE_SPENDABLE) {
1838  cache = &nAvailableCreditCached;
1839  cache_used = &fAvailableCreditCached;
1840  } else if (filter == ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY) {
1841  cache = &nAvailableWatchCreditCached;
1842  cache_used = &fAvailableWatchCreditCached;
1843  }
1844 
1845  if (fUseCache && cache_used && *cache_used) {
1846  return *cache;
1847  }
1848 
1849  CAmount nCredit = 0;
1850  uint256 hashTx = GetHash();
1851  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < tx->vout.size(); i++)
1852  {
1853  if (!pwallet->IsSpent(locked_chain, hashTx, i))
1854  {
1855  const CTxOut &txout = tx->vout[i];
1856  nCredit += pwallet->GetCredit(txout, filter);
1857  if (!MoneyRange(nCredit))
1858  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + " : value out of range");
1859  }
1860  }
1861 
1862  if (cache) {
1863  *cache = nCredit;
1864  assert(cache_used);
1865  *cache_used = true;
1866  }
1867  return nCredit;
1868 }
1869 
1870 CAmount CWalletTx::GetImmatureWatchOnlyCredit(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, const bool fUseCache) const
1871 {
1872  if (IsImmatureCoinBase(locked_chain) && IsInMainChain(locked_chain)) {
1873  if (fUseCache && fImmatureWatchCreditCached)
1874  return nImmatureWatchCreditCached;
1875  nImmatureWatchCreditCached = pwallet->GetCredit(*tx, ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY);
1876  fImmatureWatchCreditCached = true;
1877  return nImmatureWatchCreditCached;
1878  }
1879 
1880  return 0;
1881 }

1896 
1897 bool CWalletTx::IsTrusted(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain) const
1898 {
1899  LockAnnotation lock(::cs_main); // Temporary, for CheckFinalTx below. Removed in upcoming commit.
1900 
1901  // Quick answer in most cases
1902  if (!CheckFinalTx(*tx))
1903  return false;
1904  int nDepth = GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
1905  if (nDepth >= 1)
1906  return true;
1907  if (nDepth < 0)
1908  return false;
1909  if (!pwallet->m_spend_zero_conf_change || !IsFromMe(ISMINE_ALL)) // using wtx's cached debit
1910  return false;
1911 
1912  // Don't trust unconfirmed transactions from us unless they are in the mempool.
1913  if (!InMempool())
1914  return false;
1915 
1916  // Trusted if all inputs are from us and are in the mempool:
1917  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx->vin)
1918  {
1919  // Transactions not sent by us: not trusted
1920  const CWalletTx* parent = pwallet->GetWalletTx(txin.prevout.hash);
1921  if (parent == nullptr)
1922  return false;
1923  const CTxOut& parentOut = parent->tx->vout[txin.prevout.n];
1924  if (pwallet->IsMine(parentOut) != ISMINE_SPENDABLE)
1925  return false;
1926  }
1927  return true;
1928 }
1929 
1930 bool CWalletTx::IsEquivalentTo(const CWalletTx& _tx) const
1931 {
1932  CMutableTransaction tx1 {*this->tx};
1933  CMutableTransaction tx2 {*_tx.tx};
1934  for (auto& txin : tx1.vin) txin.scriptSig = CScript();
1935  for (auto& txin : tx2.vin) txin.scriptSig = CScript();
1936  return CTransaction(tx1) == CTransaction(tx2);
1937 }

1939 std::vector<uint256> CWallet::ResendWalletTransactionsBefore(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, int64_t nTime, CConnman* connman)
1940 {
1941  std::vector<uint256> result;
1942 
1943  LOCK(cs_wallet);
1944 
1945  // Sort them in chronological order
1946  std::multimap<unsigned int, CWalletTx*> mapSorted;
1947  for (std::pair<const uint256, CWalletTx>& item : mapWallet)
1948  {
1949  CWalletTx& wtx = item.second;
1950  // Don't rebroadcast if newer than nTime:
1951  if (wtx.nTimeReceived > nTime)
1952  continue;
1953  mapSorted.insert(std::make_pair(wtx.nTimeReceived, &wtx));
1954  }
1955  for (const std::pair<const unsigned int, CWalletTx*>& item : mapSorted)
1956  {
1957  CWalletTx& wtx = *item.second;
1958  if (wtx.RelayWalletTransaction(locked_chain, connman))
1959  result.push_back(wtx.GetHash());
1960  }
1961  return result;
1962 }
1963 
1964 void CWallet::ResendWalletTransactions(int64_t nBestBlockTime, CConnman* connman)
1965 {
1966  // Do this infrequently and randomly to avoid giving away
1967  // that these are our transactions.
1968  if (GetTime() < nNextResend || !fBroadcastTransactions)
1969  return;
1970  bool fFirst = (nNextResend == 0);
1971  nNextResend = GetTime() + GetRand(30 * 60);
1972  if (fFirst)
1973  return;
1974 
1975  // Only do it if there's been a new block since last time
1976  if (nBestBlockTime < nLastResend)
1977  return;
1978  nLastResend = GetTime();
1979 
1980  // Rebroadcast unconfirmed txes older than 5 minutes before the last
1981  // block was found:
1982  auto locked_chain = chain().assumeLocked(); // Temporary. Removed in upcoming lock cleanup
1983  std::vector<uint256> relayed = ResendWalletTransactionsBefore(*locked_chain, nBestBlockTime-5*60, connman);
1984  if (!relayed.empty())
1985  WalletLogPrintf("%s: rebroadcast %u unconfirmed transactions\n", __func__, relayed.size());
1986 }
1987  // end of mapWallet
1989

1991

1999 CAmount CWallet::GetBalance(const isminefilter& filter, const int min_depth) const
2000 {
2001  CAmount nTotal = 0;
2002  {
2003  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
2004  LOCK(cs_wallet);
2005  for (const auto& entry : mapWallet)
2006  {
2007  const CWalletTx* pcoin = &entry.second;
2008  if (pcoin->IsTrusted(*locked_chain) && pcoin->GetDepthInMainChain(*locked_chain) >= min_depth) {
2009  nTotal += pcoin->GetAvailableCredit(*locked_chain, true, filter);
2010  }
2011  }
2012  }
2013 
2014  return nTotal;
2015 }

2078 
2079 // Calculate total balance in a different way from GetBalance. The biggest
2080 // difference is that GetBalance sums up all unspent TxOuts paying to the
2081 // wallet, while this sums up both spent and unspent TxOuts paying to the
2082 // wallet, and then subtracts the values of TxIns spending from the wallet. This
2083 // also has fewer restrictions on which unconfirmed transactions are considered
2084 // trusted.
2085 CAmount CWallet::GetLegacyBalance(const isminefilter& filter, int minDepth) const
2086 {
2087  LockAnnotation lock(::cs_main); // Temporary, for CheckFinalTx below. Removed in upcoming commit.
2088  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
2089  LOCK(cs_wallet);
2090 
2091  CAmount balance = 0;
2092  for (const auto& entry : mapWallet) {
2093  const CWalletTx& wtx = entry.second;
2094  const int depth = wtx.GetDepthInMainChain(*locked_chain);
2095  if (depth < 0 || !CheckFinalTx(*wtx.tx) || wtx.IsImmatureCoinBase(*locked_chain)) {
2096  continue;
2097  }
2098 
2099  // Loop through tx outputs and add incoming payments. For outgoing txs,
2100  // treat change outputs specially, as part of the amount debited.
2101  CAmount debit = wtx.GetDebit(filter);
2102  const bool outgoing = debit > 0;
2103  for (const CTxOut& out : wtx.tx->vout) {
2104  if (outgoing && IsChange(out)) {
2105  debit -= out.nValue;
2106  } else if (IsMine(out) & filter && depth >= minDepth) {
2107  balance += out.nValue;
2108  }
2109  }
2110 
2111  // For outgoing txs, subtract amount debited.
2112  if (outgoing) {
2113  balance -= debit;
2114  }
2115  }
2116 
2117  return balance;
2118 }
2119 
2120 CAmount CWallet::GetAvailableBalance(const CCoinControl* coinControl) const
2121 {
2122  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
2123  LOCK(cs_wallet);
2124 
2125  CAmount balance = 0;
2126  std::vector<COutput> vCoins;
2127  AvailableCoins(*locked_chain, vCoins, true, coinControl);
2128  for (const COutput& out : vCoins) {
2129  if (out.fSpendable) {
2130  balance += out.tx->tx->vout[out.i].nValue;
2131  }
2132  }
2133  return balance;
2134 }
2135 
2136 void CWallet::AvailableCoins(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, std::vector<COutput> &vCoins, bool fOnlySafe, const CCoinControl *coinControl, const CAmount &nMinimumAmount, const CAmount &nMaximumAmount, const CAmount &nMinimumSumAmount, const uint64_t nMaximumCount, const int nMinDepth, const int nMaxDepth) const
2137 {
2138  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2139  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
2140 
2141  vCoins.clear();
2142  CAmount nTotal = 0;
2143 
2144  for (const auto& entry : mapWallet)
2145  {
2146  const uint256& wtxid = entry.first;
2147  const CWalletTx* pcoin = &entry.second;
2148 
2149  if (!CheckFinalTx(*pcoin->tx))
2150  continue;
2151 
2152  if (pcoin->IsImmatureCoinBase(locked_chain))
2153  continue;
2154 
2155  int nDepth = pcoin->GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
2156  if (nDepth < 0)
2157  continue;
2158 
2159  // We should not consider coins which aren't at least in our mempool
2160  // It's possible for these to be conflicted via ancestors which we may never be able to detect
2161  if (nDepth == 0 && !pcoin->InMempool())
2162  continue;
2163 
2164  bool safeTx = pcoin->IsTrusted(locked_chain);
2165 
2166  // We should not consider coins from transactions that are replacing
2167  // other transactions.
2168  //
2169  // Example: There is a transaction A which is replaced by bumpfee
2170  // transaction B. In this case, we want to prevent creation of
2171  // a transaction B' which spends an output of B.
2172  //
2173  // Reason: If transaction A were initially confirmed, transactions B
2174  // and B' would no longer be valid, so the user would have to create
2175  // a new transaction C to replace B'. However, in the case of a
2176  // one-block reorg, transactions B' and C might BOTH be accepted,
2177  // when the user only wanted one of them. Specifically, there could
2178  // be a 1-block reorg away from the chain where transactions A and C
2179  // were accepted to another chain where B, B', and C were all
2180  // accepted.
2181  if (nDepth == 0 && pcoin->mapValue.count("replaces_txid")) {
2182  safeTx = false;
2183  }
2184 
2185  // Similarly, we should not consider coins from transactions that
2186  // have been replaced. In the example above, we would want to prevent
2187  // creation of a transaction A' spending an output of A, because if
2188  // transaction B were initially confirmed, conflicting with A and
2189  // A', we wouldn't want to the user to create a transaction D
2190  // intending to replace A', but potentially resulting in a scenario
2191  // where A, A', and D could all be accepted (instead of just B and
2192  // D, or just A and A' like the user would want).
2193  if (nDepth == 0 && pcoin->mapValue.count("replaced_by_txid")) {
2194  safeTx = false;
2195  }
2196 
2197  if (fOnlySafe && !safeTx) {
2198  continue;
2199  }
2200 
2201  if (nDepth < nMinDepth || nDepth > nMaxDepth)
2202  continue;
2203 
2204  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < pcoin->tx->vout.size(); i++) {
2205  if (pcoin->tx->vout[i].nValue < nMinimumAmount || pcoin->tx->vout[i].nValue > nMaximumAmount)
2206  continue;
2207 
2208  if (coinControl && coinControl->HasSelected() && !coinControl->fAllowOtherInputs && !coinControl->IsSelected(COutPoint(entry.first, i)))
2209  continue;
2210 
2211  if (IsLockedCoin(entry.first, i))
2212  continue;
2213 
2214  if (IsSpent(locked_chain, wtxid, i))
2215  continue;
2216 
2217  isminetype mine = IsMine(pcoin->tx->vout[i]);
2218 
2219  if (mine == ISMINE_NO) {
2220  continue;
2221  }
2222 
2223  bool solvable = IsSolvable(*this, pcoin->tx->vout[i].scriptPubKey);
2224  bool spendable = ((mine & ISMINE_SPENDABLE) != ISMINE_NO) || (((mine & ISMINE_WATCH_ONLY) != ISMINE_NO) && (coinControl && coinControl->fAllowWatchOnly && solvable));
2225 
2226  vCoins.push_back(COutput(pcoin, i, nDepth, spendable, solvable, safeTx, (coinControl && coinControl->fAllowWatchOnly)));
2227 
2228  // Checks the sum amount of all UTXO's.
2229  if (nMinimumSumAmount != MAX_MONEY) {
2230  nTotal += pcoin->tx->vout[i].nValue;
2231 
2232  if (nTotal >= nMinimumSumAmount) {
2233  return;
2234  }
2235  }
2236 
2237  // Checks the maximum number of UTXO's.
2238  if (nMaximumCount > 0 && vCoins.size() >= nMaximumCount) {
2239  return;
2240  }
2241  }
2242  }
2243 }
2244 
2245 std::map<CTxDestination, std::vector<COutput>> CWallet::ListCoins(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain) const
2246 {
2247  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
2248  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
2249 
2250  std::map<CTxDestination, std::vector<COutput>> result;
2251  std::vector<COutput> availableCoins;
2252 
2253  AvailableCoins(locked_chain, availableCoins);
2254 
2255  for (const COutput& coin : availableCoins) {
2256  CTxDestination address;
2257  if (coin.fSpendable &&
2258  ExtractDestination(FindNonChangeParentOutput(*coin.tx->tx, coin.i).scriptPubKey, address)) {
2259  result[address].emplace_back(std::move(coin));
2260  }
2261  }
2262 
2263  std::vector<COutPoint> lockedCoins;
2264  ListLockedCoins(lockedCoins);
2265  for (const COutPoint& output : lockedCoins) {
2266  auto it = mapWallet.find(output.hash);
2267  if (it != mapWallet.end()) {
2268  int depth = it->second.GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
2269  if (depth >= 0 && output.n < it->second.tx->vout.size() &&
2270  IsMine(it->second.tx->vout[output.n]) == ISMINE_SPENDABLE) {
2271  CTxDestination address;
2272  if (ExtractDestination(FindNonChangeParentOutput(*it->second.tx, output.n).scriptPubKey, address)) {
2273  result[address].emplace_back(
2274  &it->second, output.n, depth, true /* spendable */, true /* solvable */, false /* safe */);
2275  }
2276  }
2277  }
2278  }
2279 
2280  return result;
2281 }
2282 
2283 const CTxOut& CWallet::FindNonChangeParentOutput(const CTransaction& tx, int output) const
2284 {
2285  const CTransaction* ptx = &tx;
2286  int n = output;
2287  while (IsChange(ptx->vout[n]) && ptx->vin.size() > 0) {
2288  const COutPoint& prevout = ptx->vin[0].prevout;
2289  auto it = mapWallet.find(prevout.hash);
2290  if (it == mapWallet.end() || it->second.tx->vout.size() <= prevout.n ||
2291  !IsMine(it->second.tx->vout[prevout.n])) {
2292  break;
2293  }
2294  ptx = it->second.tx.get();
2295  n = prevout.n;
2296  }
2297  return ptx->vout[n];
2298 }
