2300 bool CWallet::SelectCoinsMinConf(const CAmount& nTargetValue, const CoinEligibilityFilter& eligibility_filter, std::vector<OutputGroup> groups,
2301  std::set<CInputCoin>& setCoinsRet, CAmount& nValueRet, const CoinSelectionParams& coin_selection_params, bool& bnb_used) const
2302 {
2303  setCoinsRet.clear();
2304  nValueRet = 0;
2305 
2306  std::vector<OutputGroup> utxo_pool;
2307  if (coin_selection_params.use_bnb) {
2308  // Get long term estimate
2309  FeeCalculation feeCalc;
2310  CCoinControl temp;
2311  temp.m_confirm_target = 1008;
2312  CFeeRate long_term_feerate = GetMinimumFeeRate(*this, temp, ::mempool, ::feeEstimator, &feeCalc);
2313 
2314  // Calculate cost of change
2315  CAmount cost_of_change = GetDiscardRate(*this, ::feeEstimator).GetFee(coin_selection_params.change_spend_size) + coin_selection_params.effective_fee.GetFee(coin_selection_params.change_output_size);
2316 
2317  // Filter by the min conf specs and add to utxo_pool and calculate effective value
2318  for (OutputGroup& group : groups) {
2319  if (!group.EligibleForSpending(eligibility_filter)) continue;
2320 
2321  group.fee = 0;
2322  group.long_term_fee = 0;
2323  group.effective_value = 0;
2324  for (auto it = group.m_outputs.begin(); it != group.m_outputs.end(); ) {
2325  const CInputCoin& coin = *it;
2326  CAmount effective_value = coin.txout.nValue - (coin.m_input_bytes < 0 ? 0 : coin_selection_params.effective_fee.GetFee(coin.m_input_bytes));
2327  // Only include outputs that are positive effective value (i.e. not dust)
2328  if (effective_value > 0) {
2329  group.fee += coin.m_input_bytes < 0 ? 0 : coin_selection_params.effective_fee.GetFee(coin.m_input_bytes);
2330  group.long_term_fee += coin.m_input_bytes < 0 ? 0 : long_term_feerate.GetFee(coin.m_input_bytes);
2331  group.effective_value += effective_value;
2332  ++it;
2333  } else {
2334  it = group.Discard(coin);
2335  }
2336  }
2337  if (group.effective_value > 0) utxo_pool.push_back(group);
2338  }
2339  // Calculate the fees for things that aren't inputs
2340  CAmount not_input_fees = coin_selection_params.effective_fee.GetFee(coin_selection_params.tx_noinputs_size);
2341  bnb_used = true;
2342  return SelectCoinsBnB(utxo_pool, nTargetValue, cost_of_change, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, not_input_fees);
2343  } else {
2344  // Filter by the min conf specs and add to utxo_pool
2345  for (const OutputGroup& group : groups) {
2346  if (!group.EligibleForSpending(eligibility_filter)) continue;
2347  utxo_pool.push_back(group);
2348  }
2349  bnb_used = false;
2350  return KnapsackSolver(nTargetValue, utxo_pool, setCoinsRet, nValueRet);
2351  }
2352 }
2353 
2354 bool CWallet::SelectCoins(const std::vector<COutput>& vAvailableCoins, const CAmount& nTargetValue, std::set<CInputCoin>& setCoinsRet, CAmount& nValueRet, const CCoinControl& coin_control, CoinSelectionParams& coin_selection_params, bool& bnb_used) const
2355 {
2356  std::vector<COutput> vCoins(vAvailableCoins);
2357 
2358  // coin control -> return all selected outputs (we want all selected to go into the transaction for sure)
2359  if (coin_control.HasSelected() && !coin_control.fAllowOtherInputs)
2360  {
2361  // We didn't use BnB here, so set it to false.
2362  bnb_used = false;
2363 
2364  for (const COutput& out : vCoins)
2365  {
2366  if (!out.fSpendable)
2367  continue;
2368  nValueRet += out.tx->tx->vout[out.i].nValue;
2369  setCoinsRet.insert(out.GetInputCoin());
2370  }
2371  return (nValueRet >= nTargetValue);
2372  }
2373 
2374  // calculate value from preset inputs and store them
2375  std::set<CInputCoin> setPresetCoins;
2376  CAmount nValueFromPresetInputs = 0;
2377 
2378  std::vector<COutPoint> vPresetInputs;
2379  coin_control.ListSelected(vPresetInputs);
2380  for (const COutPoint& outpoint : vPresetInputs)
2381  {
2382  // For now, don't use BnB if preset inputs are selected. TODO: Enable this later
2383  bnb_used = false;
2384  coin_selection_params.use_bnb = false;
2385 
2386  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator it = mapWallet.find(outpoint.hash);
2387  if (it != mapWallet.end())
2388  {
2389  const CWalletTx* pcoin = &it->second;
2390  // Clearly invalid input, fail
2391  if (pcoin->tx->vout.size() <= outpoint.n)
2392  return false;
2393  // Just to calculate the marginal byte size
2394  nValueFromPresetInputs += pcoin->tx->vout[outpoint.n].nValue;
2395  setPresetCoins.insert(CInputCoin(pcoin->tx, outpoint.n));
2396  } else
2397  return false; // TODO: Allow non-wallet inputs
2398  }
2399 
2400  // remove preset inputs from vCoins
2401  for (std::vector<COutput>::iterator it = vCoins.begin(); it != vCoins.end() && coin_control.HasSelected();)
2402  {
2403  if (setPresetCoins.count(it->GetInputCoin()))
2404  it = vCoins.erase(it);
2405  else
2406  ++it;
2407  }
2408 
2409  // form groups from remaining coins; note that preset coins will not
2410  // automatically have their associated (same address) coins included
2411  if (coin_control.m_avoid_partial_spends && vCoins.size() > OUTPUT_GROUP_MAX_ENTRIES) {
2412  // Cases where we have 11+ outputs all pointing to the same destination may result in
2413  // privacy leaks as they will potentially be deterministically sorted. We solve that by
2414  // explicitly shuffling the outputs before processing
2415  Shuffle(vCoins.begin(), vCoins.end(), FastRandomContext());
2416  }
2417  std::vector<OutputGroup> groups = GroupOutputs(vCoins, !coin_control.m_avoid_partial_spends);
2418 
2419  size_t max_ancestors = (size_t)std::max<int64_t>(1, gArgs.GetArg("-limitancestorcount", DEFAULT_ANCESTOR_LIMIT));
2420  size_t max_descendants = (size_t)std::max<int64_t>(1, gArgs.GetArg("-limitdescendantcount", DEFAULT_DESCENDANT_LIMIT));
2421  bool fRejectLongChains = gArgs.GetBoolArg("-walletrejectlongchains", DEFAULT_WALLET_REJECT_LONG_CHAINS);
2422 
2423  bool res = nTargetValue <= nValueFromPresetInputs ||
2424  SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(1, 6, 0), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used) ||
2425  SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(1, 1, 0), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used) ||
2426  (m_spend_zero_conf_change && SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(0, 1, 2), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used)) ||
2427  (m_spend_zero_conf_change && SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(0, 1, std::min((size_t)4, max_ancestors/3), std::min((size_t)4, max_descendants/3)), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used)) ||
2428  (m_spend_zero_conf_change && SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(0, 1, max_ancestors/2, max_descendants/2), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used)) ||
2429  (m_spend_zero_conf_change && SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(0, 1, max_ancestors-1, max_descendants-1), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used)) ||
2430  (m_spend_zero_conf_change && !fRejectLongChains && SelectCoinsMinConf(nTargetValue - nValueFromPresetInputs, CoinEligibilityFilter(0, 1, std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max()), groups, setCoinsRet, nValueRet, coin_selection_params, bnb_used));
2431 
2432  // because SelectCoinsMinConf clears the setCoinsRet, we now add the possible inputs to the coinset
2433  util::insert(setCoinsRet, setPresetCoins);
2434 
2435  // add preset inputs to the total value selected
2436  nValueRet += nValueFromPresetInputs;
2437 
2438  return res;
2439 }
2440 
2441 bool CWallet::SignTransaction(CMutableTransaction &tx)
2442 {
2443  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet); // mapWallet
2444 
2445  // sign the new tx
2446  int nIn = 0;
2447  for (auto& input : tx.vin) {
2448  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::const_iterator mi = mapWallet.find(input.prevout.hash);
2449  if(mi == mapWallet.end() || input.prevout.n >= mi->second.tx->vout.size()) {
2450  return false;
2451  }
2452  const CScript& scriptPubKey = mi->second.tx->vout[input.prevout.n].scriptPubKey;
2453  const CAmount& amount = mi->second.tx->vout[input.prevout.n].nValue;
2454  SignatureData sigdata;
2455  if (!ProduceSignature(*this, MutableTransactionSignatureCreator(&tx, nIn, amount, SIGHASH_ALL), scriptPubKey, sigdata)) {
2456  return false;
2457  }
2458  UpdateInput(input, sigdata);
2459  nIn++;
2460  }
2461  return true;
2462 }
2463 
2464 bool CWallet::FundTransaction(CMutableTransaction& tx, CAmount& nFeeRet, int& nChangePosInOut, std::string& strFailReason, bool lockUnspents, const std::set<int>& setSubtractFeeFromOutputs, CCoinControl coinControl)
2465 {
2466  std::vector<CRecipient> vecSend;
2467 
2468  // Turn the txout set into a CRecipient vector.
2469  for (size_t idx = 0; idx < tx.vout.size(); idx++) {
2470  const CTxOut& txOut = tx.vout[idx];
2471  CRecipient recipient = {txOut.scriptPubKey, txOut.nValue, setSubtractFeeFromOutputs.count(idx) == 1};
2472  vecSend.push_back(recipient);
2473  }
2474 
2475  coinControl.fAllowOtherInputs = true;
2476 
2477  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx.vin) {
2478  coinControl.Select(txin.prevout);
2479  }
2480 
2481  // Acquire the locks to prevent races to the new locked unspents between the
2482  // CreateTransaction call and LockCoin calls (when lockUnspents is true).
2483  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
2484  LOCK(cs_wallet);
2485 
2486  CReserveKey reservekey(this);
2487  CTransactionRef tx_new;
2488  if (!CreateTransaction(*locked_chain, vecSend, tx_new, reservekey, nFeeRet, nChangePosInOut, strFailReason, coinControl, false)) {
2489  return false;
2490  }
2491 
2492  if (nChangePosInOut != -1) {
2493  tx.vout.insert(tx.vout.begin() + nChangePosInOut, tx_new->vout[nChangePosInOut]);
2494  // We don't have the normal Create/Commit cycle, and don't want to risk
2495  // reusing change, so just remove the key from the keypool here.
2496  reservekey.KeepKey();
2497  }
2498 
2499  // Copy output sizes from new transaction; they may have had the fee
2500  // subtracted from them.
2501  for (unsigned int idx = 0; idx < tx.vout.size(); idx++) {
2502  tx.vout[idx].nValue = tx_new->vout[idx].nValue;
2503  }
2504 
2505  // Add new txins while keeping original txin scriptSig/order.
2506  for (const CTxIn& txin : tx_new->vin) {
2507  if (!coinControl.IsSelected(txin.prevout)) {
2508  tx.vin.push_back(txin);
2509 
2510  if (lockUnspents) {
2511  LockCoin(txin.prevout);
2512  }
2513  }
2514  }
2515 
2516  return true;
2517 }
2518 
2519 OutputType CWallet::TransactionChangeType(OutputType change_type, const std::vector<CRecipient>& vecSend)
2520 {
2521  // If -changetype is specified, always use that change type.
2522  if (change_type != OutputType::CHANGE_AUTO) {
2523  return change_type;
2524  }
2525 
2526  // if m_default_address_type is legacy, use legacy address as change (even
2527  // if some of the outputs are P2WPKH or P2WSH).
2528  if (m_default_address_type == OutputType::LEGACY) {
2529  return OutputType::LEGACY;
2530  }
2531 
2532  // if any destination is P2WPKH or P2WSH, use P2WPKH for the change
2533  // output.
2534  for (const auto& recipient : vecSend) {
2535  // Check if any destination contains a witness program:
2536  int witnessversion = 0;
2537  std::vector<unsigned char> witnessprogram;
2538  if (recipient.scriptPubKey.IsWitnessProgram(witnessversion, witnessprogram)) {
2539  return OutputType::BECH32;
2540  }
2541  }
2542 
2543  // else use m_default_address_type for change
2544  return m_default_address_type;
2545 }
2546 
2547 bool CWallet::CreateTransaction(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, const std::vector<CRecipient>& vecSend, CTransactionRef& tx, CReserveKey& reservekey, CAmount& nFeeRet,
2548  int& nChangePosInOut, std::string& strFailReason, const CCoinControl& coin_control, bool sign)
2549 {
2550  CAmount nValue = 0;
2551  int nChangePosRequest = nChangePosInOut;
2552  unsigned int nSubtractFeeFromAmount = 0;
2553  for (const auto& recipient : vecSend)
2554  {
2555  if (nValue < 0 || recipient.nAmount < 0)
2556  {
2557  strFailReason = _("Transaction amounts must not be negative");
2558  return false;
2559  }
2560  nValue += recipient.nAmount;
2561 
2562  if (recipient.fSubtractFeeFromAmount)
2563  nSubtractFeeFromAmount++;
2564  }
2565  if (vecSend.empty())
2566  {
2567  strFailReason = _("Transaction must have at least one recipient");
2568  return false;
2569  }
2570 
2571  CMutableTransaction txNew;
2572 
2573  // Discourage fee sniping.
2574  //
2575  // For a large miner the value of the transactions in the best block and
2576  // the mempool can exceed the cost of deliberately attempting to mine two
2577  // blocks to orphan the current best block. By setting nLockTime such that
2578  // only the next block can include the transaction, we discourage this
2579  // practice as the height restricted and limited blocksize gives miners
2580  // considering fee sniping fewer options for pulling off this attack.
2581  //
2582  // A simple way to think about this is from the wallet's point of view we
2583  // always want the blockchain to move forward. By setting nLockTime this
2584  // way we're basically making the statement that we only want this
2585  // transaction to appear in the next block; we don't want to potentially
2586  // encourage reorgs by allowing transactions to appear at lower heights
2587  // than the next block in forks of the best chain.
2588  //
2589  // Of course, the subsidy is high enough, and transaction volume low
2590  // enough, that fee sniping isn't a problem yet, but by implementing a fix
2591  // now we ensure code won't be written that makes assumptions about
2592  // nLockTime that preclude a fix later.
2593  txNew.nLockTime = chainActive.Height();
2594 
2595  // Secondly occasionally randomly pick a nLockTime even further back, so
2596  // that transactions that are delayed after signing for whatever reason,
2597  // e.g. high-latency mix networks and some CoinJoin implementations, have
2598  // better privacy.
2599  if (GetRandInt(10) == 0)
2600  txNew.nLockTime = std::max(0, (int)txNew.nLockTime - GetRandInt(100));
2601 
2602  assert(txNew.nLockTime <= (unsigned int)chainActive.Height());
2603  assert(txNew.nLockTime < LOCKTIME_THRESHOLD);
2604  FeeCalculation feeCalc;
2605  CAmount nFeeNeeded;
2606  int nBytes;
2607  {
2608  std::set<CInputCoin> setCoins;
2609  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
2610  LOCK(cs_wallet);
2611  {
2612  std::vector<COutput> vAvailableCoins;
2613  AvailableCoins(*locked_chain, vAvailableCoins, true, &coin_control);
2614  CoinSelectionParams coin_selection_params; // Parameters for coin selection, init with dummy
2615 
2616  // Create change script that will be used if we need change
2617  // TODO: pass in scriptChange instead of reservekey so
2618  // change transaction isn't always pay-to-bitcoin-address
2619  CScript scriptChange;
2620 
2621  // coin control: send change to custom address
2622  if (!boost::get<CNoDestination>(&coin_control.destChange)) {
2623  scriptChange = GetScriptForDestination(coin_control.destChange);
2624  } else { // no coin control: send change to newly generated address
2625  // Note: We use a new key here to keep it from being obvious which side is the change.
2626  // The drawback is that by not reusing a previous key, the change may be lost if a
2627  // backup is restored, if the backup doesn't have the new private key for the change.
2628  // If we reused the old key, it would be possible to add code to look for and
2629  // rediscover unknown transactions that were written with keys of ours to recover
2630  // post-backup change.
2631 
2632  // Reserve a new key pair from key pool
2633  if (IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
2634  strFailReason = _("Can't generate a change-address key. Private keys are disabled for this wallet.");
2635  return false;
2636  }
2637  CPubKey vchPubKey;
2638  bool ret;
2639  ret = reservekey.GetReservedKey(vchPubKey, true);
2640  if (!ret)
2641  {
2642  strFailReason = _("Keypool ran out, please call keypoolrefill first");
2643  return false;
2644  }
2645 
2646  const OutputType change_type = TransactionChangeType(coin_control.m_change_type ? *coin_control.m_change_type : m_default_change_type, vecSend);
2647 
2648  LearnRelatedScripts(vchPubKey, change_type);
2649  scriptChange = GetScriptForDestination(GetDestinationForKey(vchPubKey, change_type));
2650  }
2651  CTxOut change_prototype_txout(0, scriptChange);
2652  coin_selection_params.change_output_size = GetSerializeSize(change_prototype_txout);
2653 
2654  CFeeRate discard_rate = GetDiscardRate(*this, ::feeEstimator);
2655 
2656  // Get the fee rate to use effective values in coin selection
2657  CFeeRate nFeeRateNeeded = GetMinimumFeeRate(*this, coin_control, ::mempool, ::feeEstimator, &feeCalc);
2658 
2659  nFeeRet = 0;
2660  bool pick_new_inputs = true;
2661  CAmount nValueIn = 0;
2662 
2663  // BnB selector is the only selector used when this is true.
2664  // That should only happen on the first pass through the loop.
2665  coin_selection_params.use_bnb = nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0; // If we are doing subtract fee from recipient, then don't use BnB
2666  // Start with no fee and loop until there is enough fee
2667  while (true)
2668  {
2669  nChangePosInOut = nChangePosRequest;
2670  txNew.vin.clear();
2671  txNew.vout.clear();
2672  bool fFirst = true;
2673 
2674  CAmount nValueToSelect = nValue;
2675  if (nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0)
2676  nValueToSelect += nFeeRet;
2677 
2678  // vouts to the payees
2679  coin_selection_params.tx_noinputs_size = 11; // Static vsize overhead + outputs vsize. 4 nVersion, 4 nLocktime, 1 input count, 1 output count, 1 witness overhead (dummy, flag, stack size)
2680  for (const auto& recipient : vecSend)
2681  {
2682  CTxOut txout(recipient.nAmount, recipient.scriptPubKey);
2683 
2684  if (recipient.fSubtractFeeFromAmount)
2685  {
2686  assert(nSubtractFeeFromAmount != 0);
2687  txout.nValue -= nFeeRet / nSubtractFeeFromAmount; // Subtract fee equally from each selected recipient
2688 
2689  if (fFirst) // first receiver pays the remainder not divisible by output count
2690  {
2691  fFirst = false;
2692  txout.nValue -= nFeeRet % nSubtractFeeFromAmount;
2693  }
2694  }
2695  // Include the fee cost for outputs. Note this is only used for BnB right now
2696  coin_selection_params.tx_noinputs_size += ::GetSerializeSize(txout, PROTOCOL_VERSION);
2697 
2698  if (IsDust(txout, ::dustRelayFee))
2699  {
2700  if (recipient.fSubtractFeeFromAmount && nFeeRet > 0)
2701  {
2702  if (txout.nValue < 0)
2703  strFailReason = _("The transaction amount is too small to pay the fee");
2704  else
2705  strFailReason = _("The transaction amount is too small to send after the fee has been deducted");
2706  }
2707  else
2708  strFailReason = _("Transaction amount too small");
2709  return false;
2710  }
2711  txNew.vout.push_back(txout);
2712  }
2713 
2714  // Choose coins to use
2715  bool bnb_used;
2716  if (pick_new_inputs) {
2717  nValueIn = 0;
2718  setCoins.clear();
2719  int change_spend_size = CalculateMaximumSignedInputSize(change_prototype_txout, this);
2720  // If the wallet doesn't know how to sign change output, assume p2sh-p2wpkh
2721  // as lower-bound to allow BnB to do it's thing
2722  if (change_spend_size == -1) {
2723  coin_selection_params.change_spend_size = DUMMY_NESTED_P2WPKH_INPUT_SIZE;
2724  } else {
2725  coin_selection_params.change_spend_size = (size_t)change_spend_size;
2726  }
2727  coin_selection_params.effective_fee = nFeeRateNeeded;
2728  if (!SelectCoins(vAvailableCoins, nValueToSelect, setCoins, nValueIn, coin_control, coin_selection_params, bnb_used))
2729  {
2730  // If BnB was used, it was the first pass. No longer the first pass and continue loop with knapsack.
2731  if (bnb_used) {
2732  coin_selection_params.use_bnb = false;
2733  continue;
2734  }
2735  else {
2736  strFailReason = _("Insufficient funds");
2737  return false;
2738  }
2739  }
2740  } else {
2741  bnb_used = false;
2742  }
2743 
2744  const CAmount nChange = nValueIn - nValueToSelect;
2745  if (nChange > 0)
2746  {
2747  // Fill a vout to ourself
2748  CTxOut newTxOut(nChange, scriptChange);
2749 
2750  // Never create dust outputs; if we would, just
2751  // add the dust to the fee.
2752  // The nChange when BnB is used is always going to go to fees.
2753  if (IsDust(newTxOut, discard_rate) || bnb_used)
2754  {
2755  nChangePosInOut = -1;
2756  nFeeRet += nChange;
2757  }
2758  else
2759  {
2760  if (nChangePosInOut == -1)
2761  {
2762  // Insert change txn at random position:
2763  nChangePosInOut = GetRandInt(txNew.vout.size()+1);
2764  }
2765  else if ((unsigned int)nChangePosInOut > txNew.vout.size())
2766  {
2767  strFailReason = _("Change index out of range");
2768  return false;
2769  }
2770 
2771  std::vector<CTxOut>::iterator position = txNew.vout.begin()+nChangePosInOut;
2772  txNew.vout.insert(position, newTxOut);
2773  }
2774  } else {
2775  nChangePosInOut = -1;
2776  }
2777 
2778  // Dummy fill vin for maximum size estimation
2779  //
2780  for (const auto& coin : setCoins) {
2781  txNew.vin.push_back(CTxIn(coin.outpoint,CScript()));
2782  }
2783 
2784  nBytes = CalculateMaximumSignedTxSize(txNew, this, coin_control.fAllowWatchOnly);
2785  if (nBytes < 0) {
2786  strFailReason = _("Signing transaction failed");
2787  return false;
2788  }
2789 
2790  nFeeNeeded = GetMinimumFee(*this, nBytes, coin_control, ::mempool, ::feeEstimator, &feeCalc);
2791  if (feeCalc.reason == FeeReason::FALLBACK && !m_allow_fallback_fee) {
2792  // eventually allow a fallback fee
2793  strFailReason = _("Fee estimation failed. Fallbackfee is disabled. Wait a few blocks or enable -fallbackfee.");
2794  return false;
2795  }
2796 
2797  // If we made it here and we aren't even able to meet the relay fee on the next pass, give up
2798  // because we must be at the maximum allowed fee.
2799  if (nFeeNeeded < ::minRelayTxFee.GetFee(nBytes))
2800  {
2801  strFailReason = _("Transaction too large for fee policy");
2802  return false;
2803  }
2804 
2805  if (nFeeRet >= nFeeNeeded) {
2806  // Reduce fee to only the needed amount if possible. This
2807  // prevents potential overpayment in fees if the coins
2808  // selected to meet nFeeNeeded result in a transaction that
2809  // requires less fee than the prior iteration.
2810 
2811  // If we have no change and a big enough excess fee, then
2812  // try to construct transaction again only without picking
2813  // new inputs. We now know we only need the smaller fee
2814  // (because of reduced tx size) and so we should add a
2815  // change output. Only try this once.
2816  if (nChangePosInOut == -1 && nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0 && pick_new_inputs) {
2817  unsigned int tx_size_with_change = nBytes + coin_selection_params.change_output_size + 2; // Add 2 as a buffer in case increasing # of outputs changes compact size
2818  CAmount fee_needed_with_change = GetMinimumFee(*this, tx_size_with_change, coin_control, ::mempool, ::feeEstimator, nullptr);
2819  CAmount minimum_value_for_change = GetDustThreshold(change_prototype_txout, discard_rate);
2820  if (nFeeRet >= fee_needed_with_change + minimum_value_for_change) {
2821  pick_new_inputs = false;
2822  nFeeRet = fee_needed_with_change;
2823  continue;
2824  }
2825  }
2826 
2827  // If we have change output already, just increase it
2828  if (nFeeRet > nFeeNeeded && nChangePosInOut != -1 && nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0) {
2829  CAmount extraFeePaid = nFeeRet - nFeeNeeded;
2830  std::vector<CTxOut>::iterator change_position = txNew.vout.begin()+nChangePosInOut;
2831  change_position->nValue += extraFeePaid;
2832  nFeeRet -= extraFeePaid;
2833  }
2834  break; // Done, enough fee included.
2835  }
2836  else if (!pick_new_inputs) {
2837  // This shouldn't happen, we should have had enough excess
2838  // fee to pay for the new output and still meet nFeeNeeded
2839  // Or we should have just subtracted fee from recipients and
2840  // nFeeNeeded should not have changed
2841  strFailReason = _("Transaction fee and change calculation failed");
2842  return false;
2843  }
2844 
2845  // Try to reduce change to include necessary fee
2846  if (nChangePosInOut != -1 && nSubtractFeeFromAmount == 0) {
2847  CAmount additionalFeeNeeded = nFeeNeeded - nFeeRet;
2848  std::vector<CTxOut>::iterator change_position = txNew.vout.begin()+nChangePosInOut;
2849  // Only reduce change if remaining amount is still a large enough output.
2850  if (change_position->nValue >= MIN_FINAL_CHANGE + additionalFeeNeeded) {
2851  change_position->nValue -= additionalFeeNeeded;
2852  nFeeRet += additionalFeeNeeded;
2853  break; // Done, able to increase fee from change
2854  }
2855  }
2856 
2857  // If subtracting fee from recipients, we now know what fee we
2858  // need to subtract, we have no reason to reselect inputs
2859  if (nSubtractFeeFromAmount > 0) {
2860  pick_new_inputs = false;
2861  }
2862 
2863  // Include more fee and try again.
2864  nFeeRet = nFeeNeeded;
2865  coin_selection_params.use_bnb = false;
2866  continue;
2867  }
2868  }
2869 
2870  if (nChangePosInOut == -1) reservekey.ReturnKey(); // Return any reserved key if we don't have change
2871 
2872  // Shuffle selected coins and fill in final vin
2873  txNew.vin.clear();
2874  std::vector<CInputCoin> selected_coins(setCoins.begin(), setCoins.end());
2875  Shuffle(selected_coins.begin(), selected_coins.end(), FastRandomContext());
2876 
2877  // Note how the sequence number is set to non-maxint so that
2878  // the nLockTime set above actually works.
2879  //
2880  // BIP125 defines opt-in RBF as any nSequence < maxint-1, so
2881  // we use the highest possible value in that range (maxint-2)
2882  // to avoid conflicting with other possible uses of nSequence,
2883  // and in the spirit of "smallest possible change from prior
2884  // behavior."
2885  const uint32_t nSequence = coin_control.m_signal_bip125_rbf.get_value_or(m_signal_rbf) ? MAX_BIP125_RBF_SEQUENCE : (CTxIn::SEQUENCE_FINAL - 1);
2886  for (const auto& coin : selected_coins) {
2887  txNew.vin.push_back(CTxIn(coin.outpoint, CScript(), nSequence));
2888  }
2889 
2890  if (sign)
2891  {
2892  int nIn = 0;
2893  for (const auto& coin : selected_coins)
2894  {
2895  const CScript& scriptPubKey = coin.txout.scriptPubKey;
2896  SignatureData sigdata;
2897 
2898  if (!ProduceSignature(*this, MutableTransactionSignatureCreator(&txNew, nIn, coin.txout.nValue, SIGHASH_ALL), scriptPubKey, sigdata))
2899  {
2900  strFailReason = _("Signing transaction failed");
2901  return false;
2902  } else {
2903  UpdateInput(txNew.vin.at(nIn), sigdata);
2904  }
2905 
2906  nIn++;
2907  }
2908  }
2909 
2910  // Return the constructed transaction data.
2911  tx = MakeTransactionRef(std::move(txNew));
2912 
2913  // Limit size
2914  if (GetTransactionWeight(*tx) > MAX_STANDARD_TX_WEIGHT)
2915  {
2916  strFailReason = _("Transaction too large");
2917  return false;
2918  }
2919  }
2920 
2921  if (gArgs.GetBoolArg("-walletrejectlongchains", DEFAULT_WALLET_REJECT_LONG_CHAINS)) {
2922  // Lastly, ensure this tx will pass the mempool's chain limits
2923  LockPoints lp;
2924  CTxMemPoolEntry entry(tx, 0, 0, 0, false, 0, lp);
2925  CTxMemPool::setEntries setAncestors;
2926  size_t nLimitAncestors = gArgs.GetArg("-limitancestorcount", DEFAULT_ANCESTOR_LIMIT);
2927  size_t nLimitAncestorSize = gArgs.GetArg("-limitancestorsize", DEFAULT_ANCESTOR_SIZE_LIMIT)*1000;
2928  size_t nLimitDescendants = gArgs.GetArg("-limitdescendantcount", DEFAULT_DESCENDANT_LIMIT);
2929  size_t nLimitDescendantSize = gArgs.GetArg("-limitdescendantsize", DEFAULT_DESCENDANT_SIZE_LIMIT)*1000;
2930  std::string errString;
2931  LOCK(::mempool.cs);
2932  if (!::mempool.CalculateMemPoolAncestors(entry, setAncestors, nLimitAncestors, nLimitAncestorSize, nLimitDescendants, nLimitDescendantSize, errString)) {
2933  strFailReason = _("Transaction has too long of a mempool chain");
2934  return false;
2935  }
2936  }
2937 
2938  WalletLogPrintf("Fee Calculation: Fee:%d Bytes:%u Needed:%d Tgt:%d (requested %d) Reason:\"%s\" Decay %.5f: Estimation: (%g - %g) %.2f%% %.1f/(%.1f %d mem %.1f out) Fail: (%g - %g) %.2f%% %.1f/(%.1f %d mem %.1f out)\n",
2939  nFeeRet, nBytes, nFeeNeeded, feeCalc.returnedTarget, feeCalc.desiredTarget, StringForFeeReason(feeCalc.reason), feeCalc.est.decay,
2940  feeCalc.est.pass.start, feeCalc.est.pass.end,
2941  100 * feeCalc.est.pass.withinTarget / (feeCalc.est.pass.totalConfirmed + feeCalc.est.pass.inMempool + feeCalc.est.pass.leftMempool),
2942  feeCalc.est.pass.withinTarget, feeCalc.est.pass.totalConfirmed, feeCalc.est.pass.inMempool, feeCalc.est.pass.leftMempool,
2943  feeCalc.est.fail.start, feeCalc.est.fail.end,
2944  100 * feeCalc.est.fail.withinTarget / (feeCalc.est.fail.totalConfirmed + feeCalc.est.fail.inMempool + feeCalc.est.fail.leftMempool),
2945  feeCalc.est.fail.withinTarget, feeCalc.est.fail.totalConfirmed, feeCalc.est.fail.inMempool, feeCalc.est.fail.leftMempool);
2946  return true;
2947 }

2952 bool CWallet::CommitTransaction(CTransactionRef tx, mapValue_t mapValue, std::vector<std::pair<std::string, std::string>> orderForm, CReserveKey& reservekey, CConnman* connman, CValidationState& state)
2953 {
2954  {
2955  auto locked_chain = chain().lock();
2956  LOCK(cs_wallet);
2957 
2958  CWalletTx wtxNew(this, std::move(tx));
2959  wtxNew.mapValue = std::move(mapValue);
2960  wtxNew.vOrderForm = std::move(orderForm);
2961  wtxNew.fTimeReceivedIsTxTime = true;
2962  wtxNew.fFromMe = true;
2963 
2964  WalletLogPrintf("CommitTransaction:\n%s", wtxNew.tx->ToString()); /* Continued */
2965  {
2966  // Take key pair from key pool so it won't be used again
2967  reservekey.KeepKey();
2968 
2969  // Add tx to wallet, because if it has change it's also ours,
2970  // otherwise just for transaction history.
2971  AddToWallet(wtxNew);
2972 
2973  // Notify that old coins are spent
2974  for (const CTxIn& txin : wtxNew.tx->vin)
2975  {
2976  CWalletTx &coin = mapWallet.at(txin.prevout.hash);
2977  coin.BindWallet(this);
2978  NotifyTransactionChanged(this, coin.GetHash(), CT_UPDATED);
2979  }
2980  }
2981 
2982  // Get the inserted-CWalletTx from mapWallet so that the
2983  // fInMempool flag is cached properly
2984  CWalletTx& wtx = mapWallet.at(wtxNew.GetHash());
2985 
2986  if (fBroadcastTransactions)
2987  {
2988  // Broadcast
2989  if (!wtx.AcceptToMemoryPool(*locked_chain, maxTxFee, state)) {
2990  WalletLogPrintf("CommitTransaction(): Transaction cannot be broadcast immediately, %s\n", FormatStateMessage(state));
2991  // TODO: if we expect the failure to be long term or permanent, instead delete wtx from the wallet and return failure.
2992  } else {
2993  wtx.RelayWalletTransaction(*locked_chain, connman);
2994  }
2995  }
2996  }
2997  return true;
2998 }

3145 bool CWallet::NewKeyPool()
3146 {
3147  if (IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
3148  return false;
3149  }
3150  {
3151  LOCK(cs_wallet);
3152  WalletBatch batch(*database);
3153 
3154  for (const int64_t nIndex : setInternalKeyPool) {
3155  batch.ErasePool(nIndex);
3156  }
3157  setInternalKeyPool.clear();
3158 
3159  for (const int64_t nIndex : setExternalKeyPool) {
3160  batch.ErasePool(nIndex);
3161  }
3162  setExternalKeyPool.clear();
3163 
3164  for (const int64_t nIndex : set_pre_split_keypool) {
3165  batch.ErasePool(nIndex);
3166  }
3167  set_pre_split_keypool.clear();
3168 
3169  m_pool_key_to_index.clear();
3170 
3171  if (!TopUpKeyPool()) {
3172  return false;
3173  }
3174  WalletLogPrintf("CWallet::NewKeyPool rewrote keypool\n");
3175  }
3176  return true;
3177 }

3185 void CWallet::LoadKeyPool(int64_t nIndex, const CKeyPool &keypool)
3186 {
3187  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
3188  if (keypool.m_pre_split) {
3189  set_pre_split_keypool.insert(nIndex);
3190  } else if (keypool.fInternal) {
3191  setInternalKeyPool.insert(nIndex);
3192  } else {
3193  setExternalKeyPool.insert(nIndex);
3194  }
3195  m_max_keypool_index = std::max(m_max_keypool_index, nIndex);
3196  m_pool_key_to_index[keypool.vchPubKey.GetID()] = nIndex;
3197 
3198  // If no metadata exists yet, create a default with the pool key's
3199  // creation time. Note that this may be overwritten by actually
3200  // stored metadata for that key later, which is fine.
3201  CKeyID keyid = keypool.vchPubKey.GetID();
3202  if (mapKeyMetadata.count(keyid) == 0)
3203  mapKeyMetadata[keyid] = CKeyMetadata(keypool.nTime);

3206 bool CWallet::TopUpKeyPool(unsigned int kpSize)
3207 {
3208  if (IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
3209  return false;
3210  }
3211  {
3212  LOCK(cs_wallet);
3213 
3214  if (IsLocked())
3215  return false;
3216 
3217  // Top up key pool
3218  unsigned int nTargetSize;
3219  if (kpSize > 0)
3220  nTargetSize = kpSize;
3221  else
3222  nTargetSize = std::max(gArgs.GetArg("-keypool", DEFAULT_KEYPOOL_SIZE), (int64_t) 0);
3223 
3224  // count amount of available keys (internal, external)
3225  // make sure the keypool of external and internal keys fits the user selected target (-keypool)
3226  int64_t missingExternal = std::max(std::max((int64_t) nTargetSize, (int64_t) 1) - (int64_t)setExternalKeyPool.size(), (int64_t) 0);
3227  int64_t missingInternal = std::max(std::max((int64_t) nTargetSize, (int64_t) 1) - (int64_t)setInternalKeyPool.size(), (int64_t) 0);
3228 
3229  if (!IsHDEnabled() || !CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT))
3230  {
3231  // don't create extra internal keys
3232  missingInternal = 0;
3233  }
3234  bool internal = false;
3235  WalletBatch batch(*database);
3236  for (int64_t i = missingInternal + missingExternal; i--;)
3237  {
3238  if (i < missingInternal) {
3239  internal = true;
3240  }
3241 
3242  assert(m_max_keypool_index < std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max()); // How in the hell did you use so many keys?
3243  int64_t index = ++m_max_keypool_index;
3244 
3245  CPubKey pubkey(GenerateNewKey(batch, internal));
3246  if (!batch.WritePool(index, CKeyPool(pubkey, internal))) {
3247  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": writing generated key failed");
3248  }
3249 
3250  if (internal) {
3251  setInternalKeyPool.insert(index);
3252  } else {
3253  setExternalKeyPool.insert(index);
3254  }
3255  m_pool_key_to_index[pubkey.GetID()] = index;
3256  }
3257  if (missingInternal + missingExternal > 0) {
3258  WalletLogPrintf("keypool added %d keys (%d internal), size=%u (%u internal)\n", missingInternal + missingExternal, missingInternal, setInternalKeyPool.size() + setExternalKeyPool.size() + set_pre_split_keypool.size(), setInternalKeyPool.size());
3259  }
3260  }
3261  return true;
3262 }
3263 
3264 bool CWallet::ReserveKeyFromKeyPool(int64_t& nIndex, CKeyPool& keypool, bool fRequestedInternal)
3265 {
3266  nIndex = -1;
3267  keypool.vchPubKey = CPubKey();
3268  {
3269  LOCK(cs_wallet);
3270 
3271  if (!IsLocked())
3272  TopUpKeyPool();
3273 
3274  bool fReturningInternal = IsHDEnabled() && CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT) && fRequestedInternal;
3275  bool use_split_keypool = set_pre_split_keypool.empty();
3276  std::set<int64_t>& setKeyPool = use_split_keypool ? (fReturningInternal ? setInternalKeyPool : setExternalKeyPool) : set_pre_split_keypool;
3277 
3278  // Get the oldest key
3279  if (setKeyPool.empty()) {
3280  return false;
3281  }
3282 
3283  WalletBatch batch(*database);
3284 
3285  auto it = setKeyPool.begin();
3286  nIndex = *it;
3287  setKeyPool.erase(it);
3288  if (!batch.ReadPool(nIndex, keypool)) {
3289  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": read failed");
3290  }
3291  if (!HaveKey(keypool.vchPubKey.GetID())) {
3292  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": unknown key in key pool");
3293  }
3294  // If the key was pre-split keypool, we don't care about what type it is
3295  if (use_split_keypool && keypool.fInternal != fReturningInternal) {
3296  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": keypool entry misclassified");
3297  }
3298  if (!keypool.vchPubKey.IsValid()) {
3299  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": keypool entry invalid");
3300  }
3301 
3302  m_pool_key_to_index.erase(keypool.vchPubKey.GetID());
3303  WalletLogPrintf("keypool reserve %d\n", nIndex);
3304  }
3305  return true;
3306 }

3325  } else {

3333 bool CWallet::GetKeyFromPool(CPubKey& result, bool internal)
3334 {
3335  if (IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
3336  return false;

3387 std::map<CTxDestination, CAmount> CWallet::GetAddressBalances(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain)
3388 {
3389  std::map<CTxDestination, CAmount> balances;
3390 
3391  {
3392  LOCK(cs_wallet);
3393  for (const auto& walletEntry : mapWallet)
3394  {
3395  const CWalletTx *pcoin = &walletEntry.second;
3396 
3397  if (!pcoin->IsTrusted(locked_chain))
3398  continue;
3399 
3400  if (pcoin->IsImmatureCoinBase(locked_chain))
3401  continue;
3402 
3403  int nDepth = pcoin->GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
3404  if (nDepth < (pcoin->IsFromMe(ISMINE_ALL) ? 0 : 1))
3405  continue;
3406 
3407  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < pcoin->tx->vout.size(); i++)
3408  {
3409  CTxDestination addr;
3410  if (!IsMine(pcoin->tx->vout[i]))
3411  continue;
3412  if(!ExtractDestination(pcoin->tx->vout[i].scriptPubKey, addr))
3413  continue;
3414 
3415  CAmount n = IsSpent(locked_chain, walletEntry.first, i) ? 0 : pcoin->tx->vout[i].nValue;
3416 
3417  if (!balances.count(addr))
3418  balances[addr] = 0;
3419  balances[addr] += n;
3420  }
3421  }
3422  }
3423 
3424  return balances;
3425 }
3426 
3427 std::set< std::set<CTxDestination> > CWallet::GetAddressGroupings()
3428 {
3429  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet); // mapWallet
3430  std::set< std::set<CTxDestination> > groupings;
3431  std::set<CTxDestination> grouping;
3432 
3433  for (const auto& walletEntry : mapWallet)
3434  {
3435  const CWalletTx *pcoin = &walletEntry.second;
3436 
3437  if (pcoin->tx->vin.size() > 0)
3438  {
3439  bool any_mine = false;
3440  // group all input addresses with each other
3441  for (const CTxIn& txin : pcoin->tx->vin)
3442  {
3443  CTxDestination address;
3444  if(!IsMine(txin)) /* If this input isn't mine, ignore it */
3445  continue;
3446  if(!ExtractDestination(mapWallet.at(txin.prevout.hash).tx->vout[txin.prevout.n].scriptPubKey, address))
3447  continue;
3448  grouping.insert(address);
3449  any_mine = true;
3450  }
3451 
3452  // group change with input addresses
3453  if (any_mine)
3454  {
3455  for (const CTxOut& txout : pcoin->tx->vout)
3456  if (IsChange(txout))
3457  {
3458  CTxDestination txoutAddr;
3459  if(!ExtractDestination(txout.scriptPubKey, txoutAddr))
3460  continue;
3461  grouping.insert(txoutAddr);
3462  }
3463  }
3464  if (grouping.size() > 0)
3465  {
3466  groupings.insert(grouping);
3467  grouping.clear();
3468  }
3469  }
3470 
3471  // group lone addrs by themselves
3472  for (const auto& txout : pcoin->tx->vout)
3473  if (IsMine(txout))
3474  {
3475  CTxDestination address;
3476  if(!ExtractDestination(txout.scriptPubKey, address))
3477  continue;
3478  grouping.insert(address);
3479  groupings.insert(grouping);
3480  grouping.clear();
3481  }
3482  }
3483 
3484  std::set< std::set<CTxDestination>* > uniqueGroupings; // a set of pointers to groups of addresses
3485  std::map< CTxDestination, std::set<CTxDestination>* > setmap; // map addresses to the unique group containing it
3486  for (std::set<CTxDestination> _grouping : groupings)
3487  {
3488  // make a set of all the groups hit by this new group
3489  std::set< std::set<CTxDestination>* > hits;
3490  std::map< CTxDestination, std::set<CTxDestination>* >::iterator it;
3491  for (const CTxDestination& address : _grouping)
3492  if ((it = setmap.find(address)) != setmap.end())
3493  hits.insert((*it).second);
3494 
3495  // merge all hit groups into a new single group and delete old groups
3496  std::set<CTxDestination>* merged = new std::set<CTxDestination>(_grouping);
3497  for (std::set<CTxDestination>* hit : hits)
3498  {
3499  merged->insert(hit->begin(), hit->end());
3500  uniqueGroupings.erase(hit);
3501  delete hit;
3502  }
3503  uniqueGroupings.insert(merged);
3504 
3505  // update setmap
3506  for (const CTxDestination& element : *merged)
3507  setmap[element] = merged;
3508  }
3509 
3510  std::set< std::set<CTxDestination> > ret;
3511  for (const std::set<CTxDestination>* uniqueGrouping : uniqueGroupings)
3512  {
3513  ret.insert(*uniqueGrouping);
3514  delete uniqueGrouping;
3515  }
3516 
3517  return ret;
3518 }
3519 
3520 std::set<CTxDestination> CWallet::GetLabelAddresses(const std::string& label) const
3521 {
3522  LOCK(cs_wallet);
3523  std::set<CTxDestination> result;
3524  for (const std::pair<const CTxDestination, CAddressBookData>& item : mapAddressBook)
3525  {
3526  const CTxDestination& address = item.first;
3527  const std::string& strName = item.second.name;
3528  if (strName == label)
3529  result.insert(address);
3530  }
3531  return result;
3532 }

3567 void CWallet::MarkReserveKeysAsUsed(int64_t keypool_id)
3568 {
3569  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet);
3570  bool internal = setInternalKeyPool.count(keypool_id);
3571  if (!internal) assert(setExternalKeyPool.count(keypool_id) || set_pre_split_keypool.count(keypool_id));
3572  std::set<int64_t> *setKeyPool = internal ? &setInternalKeyPool : (set_pre_split_keypool.empty() ? &setExternalKeyPool : &set_pre_split_keypool);
3573  auto it = setKeyPool->begin();
3574 
3575  WalletBatch batch(*database);
3576  while (it != std::end(*setKeyPool)) {
3577  const int64_t& index = *(it);
3578  if (index > keypool_id) break; // set*KeyPool is ordered
3579 
3580  CKeyPool keypool;
3581  if (batch.ReadPool(index, keypool)) { //TODO: This should be unnecessary
3582  m_pool_key_to_index.erase(keypool.vchPubKey.GetID());
3583  }
3584  LearnAllRelatedScripts(keypool.vchPubKey);
3585  batch.ErasePool(index);
3586  WalletLogPrintf("keypool index %d removed\n", index);
3587  it = setKeyPool->erase(it);
3588  }
3589 }

3640 void CWallet::GetKeyBirthTimes(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, std::map<CTxDestination, int64_t> &mapKeyBirth) const {
3641  AssertLockHeld(cs_wallet); // mapKeyMetadata
3642  mapKeyBirth.clear();
3643 
3644  // get birth times for keys with metadata
3645  for (const auto& entry : mapKeyMetadata) {
3646  if (entry.second.nCreateTime) {
3647  mapKeyBirth[entry.first] = entry.second.nCreateTime;
3648  }
3649  }
3650 
3651  // map in which we'll infer heights of other keys
3652  CBlockIndex *pindexMax = chainActive[std::max(0, chainActive.Height() - 144)]; // the tip can be reorganized; use a 144-block safety margin
3653  std::map<CKeyID, CBlockIndex*> mapKeyFirstBlock;
3654  for (const CKeyID &keyid : GetKeys()) {
3655  if (mapKeyBirth.count(keyid) == 0)
3656  mapKeyFirstBlock[keyid] = pindexMax;
3657  }
3658 
3659  // if there are no such keys, we're done
3660  if (mapKeyFirstBlock.empty())
3661  return;
3662 
3663  // find first block that affects those keys, if there are any left
3664  for (const auto& entry : mapWallet) {
3665  // iterate over all wallet transactions...
3666  const CWalletTx &wtx = entry.second;
3667  CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(wtx.hashBlock);
3668  if (pindex && chainActive.Contains(pindex)) {
3669  // ... which are already in a block
3670  int nHeight = pindex->nHeight;
3671  for (const CTxOut &txout : wtx.tx->vout) {
3672  // iterate over all their outputs
3673  for (const auto &keyid : GetAffectedKeys(txout.scriptPubKey, *this)) {
3674  // ... and all their affected keys
3675  std::map<CKeyID, CBlockIndex*>::iterator rit = mapKeyFirstBlock.find(keyid);
3676  if (rit != mapKeyFirstBlock.end() && nHeight < rit->second->nHeight)
3677  rit->second = pindex;
3678  }
3679  }
3680  }
3681  }
3682 
3683  // Extract block timestamps for those keys
3684  for (const auto& entry : mapKeyFirstBlock)
3685  mapKeyBirth[entry.first] = entry.second->GetBlockTime() - TIMESTAMP_WINDOW; // block times can be 2h off
3686 }
3687 
3709 unsigned int CWallet::ComputeTimeSmart(const CWalletTx& wtx) const
3710 {
3711  unsigned int nTimeSmart = wtx.nTimeReceived;
3712  if (!wtx.hashUnset()) {
3713  if (const CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(wtx.hashBlock)) {
3714  int64_t latestNow = wtx.nTimeReceived;
3715  int64_t latestEntry = 0;
3716 
3717  // Tolerate times up to the last timestamp in the wallet not more than 5 minutes into the future
3718  int64_t latestTolerated = latestNow + 300;
3719  const TxItems& txOrdered = wtxOrdered;
3720  for (auto it = txOrdered.rbegin(); it != txOrdered.rend(); ++it) {
3721  CWalletTx* const pwtx = it->second;
3722  if (pwtx == &wtx) {
3723  continue;
3724  }
3725  int64_t nSmartTime;
3726  nSmartTime = pwtx->nTimeSmart;
3727  if (!nSmartTime) {
3728  nSmartTime = pwtx->nTimeReceived;
3729  }
3730  if (nSmartTime <= latestTolerated) {
3731  latestEntry = nSmartTime;
3732  if (nSmartTime > latestNow) {
3733  latestNow = nSmartTime;
3734  }
3735  break;
3736  }
3737  }
3738 
3739  int64_t blocktime = pindex->GetBlockTime();
3740  nTimeSmart = std::max(latestEntry, std::min(blocktime, latestNow));
3741  } else {
3742  WalletLogPrintf("%s: found %s in block %s not in index\n", __func__, wtx.GetHash().ToString(), wtx.hashBlock.ToString());
3743  }
3744  }
3745  return nTimeSmart;
3746 }

3799 void CWallet::MarkPreSplitKeys()
3800 {
3801  WalletBatch batch(*database);
3802  for (auto it = setExternalKeyPool.begin(); it != setExternalKeyPool.end();) {
3803  int64_t index = *it;
3804  CKeyPool keypool;
3805  if (!batch.ReadPool(index, keypool)) {
3806  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": read keypool entry failed");
3807  }
3808  keypool.m_pre_split = true;
3809  if (!batch.WritePool(index, keypool)) {
3810  throw std::runtime_error(std::string(__func__) + ": writing modified keypool entry failed");
3811  }
3812  set_pre_split_keypool.insert(index);
3813  it = setExternalKeyPool.erase(it);
3814  }
3815 }

3817 bool CWallet::Verify(interfaces::Chain& chain, const WalletLocation& location, bool salvage_wallet, std::string& error_string, std::string& warning_string)
3818 {
3819  // Do some checking on wallet path. It should be either a:
3820  //
3821  // 1. Path where a directory can be created.
3822  // 2. Path to an existing directory.
3823  // 3. Path to a symlink to a directory.
3824  // 4. For backwards compatibility, the name of a data file in -walletdir.
3825  LOCK(cs_wallets);
3826  const fs::path& wallet_path = location.GetPath();
3827  fs::file_type path_type = fs::symlink_status(wallet_path).type();
3828  if (!(path_type == fs::file_not_found || path_type == fs::directory_file ||
3829  (path_type == fs::symlink_file && fs::is_directory(wallet_path)) ||
3830  (path_type == fs::regular_file && fs::path(location.GetName()).filename() == location.GetName()))) {
3831  error_string = strprintf(
3832  "Invalid -wallet path '%s'. -wallet path should point to a directory where wallet.dat and "
3833  "database/log.?????????? files can be stored, a location where such a directory could be created, "
3834  "or (for backwards compatibility) the name of an existing data file in -walletdir (%s)",
3835  location.GetName(), GetWalletDir());
3836  return false;
3837  }
3838 
3839  // Make sure that the wallet path doesn't clash with an existing wallet path
3840  if (IsWalletLoaded(wallet_path)) {
3841  error_string = strprintf("Error loading wallet %s. Duplicate -wallet filename specified.", location.GetName());
3842  return false;
3843  }
3844 
3845  try {
3846  if (!WalletBatch::VerifyEnvironment(wallet_path, error_string)) {
3847  return false;
3848  }
3849  } catch (const fs::filesystem_error& e) {
3850  error_string = strprintf("Error loading wallet %s. %s", location.GetName(), fsbridge::get_filesystem_error_message(e));
3851  return false;
3852  }
3853 
3854  if (salvage_wallet) {
3855  // Recover readable keypairs:
3856  CWallet dummyWallet(chain, WalletLocation(), WalletDatabase::CreateDummy());
3857  std::string backup_filename;
3858  if (!WalletBatch::Recover(wallet_path, (void *)&dummyWallet, WalletBatch::RecoverKeysOnlyFilter, backup_filename)) {
3859  return false;
3860  }
3861  }
3862 
3863  return WalletBatch::VerifyDatabaseFile(wallet_path, warning_string, error_string);
3864 }
3865 
3866 std::shared_ptr<CWallet> CWallet::CreateWalletFromFile(interfaces::Chain& chain, const WalletLocation& location, uint64_t wallet_creation_flags)
3867 {
3868  const std::string& walletFile = location.GetName();
3869 
3870  // needed to restore wallet transaction meta data after -zapwallettxes
3871  std::vector<CWalletTx> vWtx;
3872 
3873  if (gArgs.GetBoolArg("-zapwallettxes", false)) {
3874  uiInterface.InitMessage(_("Zapping all transactions from wallet..."));
3875 
3876  std::unique_ptr<CWallet> tempWallet = MakeUnique<CWallet>(chain, location, WalletDatabase::Create(location.GetPath()));
3877  DBErrors nZapWalletRet = tempWallet->ZapWalletTx(vWtx);
3878  if (nZapWalletRet != DBErrors::LOAD_OK) {
3879  InitError(strprintf(_("Error loading %s: Wallet corrupted"), walletFile));
3880  return nullptr;
3881  }
3882  }
3883 
3884  uiInterface.InitMessage(_("Loading wallet..."));
3885 
3886  int64_t nStart = GetTimeMillis();
3887  bool fFirstRun = true;
3888  // TODO: Can't use std::make_shared because we need a custom deleter but
3889  // should be possible to use std::allocate_shared.
3890  std::shared_ptr<CWallet> walletInstance(new CWallet(chain, location, WalletDatabase::Create(location.GetPath())), ReleaseWallet);
3891  DBErrors nLoadWalletRet = walletInstance->LoadWallet(fFirstRun);
3892  if (nLoadWalletRet != DBErrors::LOAD_OK)
3893  {
3894  if (nLoadWalletRet == DBErrors::CORRUPT) {
3895  InitError(strprintf(_("Error loading %s: Wallet corrupted"), walletFile));
3896  return nullptr;
3897  }
3898  else if (nLoadWalletRet == DBErrors::NONCRITICAL_ERROR)
3899  {
3900  InitWarning(strprintf(_("Error reading %s! All keys read correctly, but transaction data"
3901  " or address book entries might be missing or incorrect."),
3902  walletFile));
3903  }
3904  else if (nLoadWalletRet == DBErrors::TOO_NEW) {
3905  InitError(strprintf(_("Error loading %s: Wallet requires newer version of %s"), walletFile, _(PACKAGE_NAME)));
3906  return nullptr;
3907  }
3908  else if (nLoadWalletRet == DBErrors::NEED_REWRITE)
3909  {
3910  InitError(strprintf(_("Wallet needed to be rewritten: restart %s to complete"), _(PACKAGE_NAME)));
3911  return nullptr;
3912  }
3913  else {
3914  InitError(strprintf(_("Error loading %s"), walletFile));
3915  return nullptr;
3916  }
3917  }
3918 
3919  int prev_version = walletInstance->nWalletVersion;
3920  if (gArgs.GetBoolArg("-upgradewallet", fFirstRun))
3921  {
3922  int nMaxVersion = gArgs.GetArg("-upgradewallet", 0);
3923  if (nMaxVersion == 0) // the -upgradewallet without argument case
3924  {
3925  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Performing wallet upgrade to %i\n", FEATURE_LATEST);
3926  nMaxVersion = FEATURE_LATEST;
3927  walletInstance->SetMinVersion(FEATURE_LATEST); // permanently upgrade the wallet immediately
3928  }
3929  else
3930  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Allowing wallet upgrade up to %i\n", nMaxVersion);
3931  if (nMaxVersion < walletInstance->GetVersion())
3932  {
3933  InitError(_("Cannot downgrade wallet"));
3934  return nullptr;
3935  }
3936  walletInstance->SetMaxVersion(nMaxVersion);
3937  }
3938 
3939  // Upgrade to HD if explicit upgrade
3940  if (gArgs.GetBoolArg("-upgradewallet", false)) {
3941  LOCK(walletInstance->cs_wallet);
3942 
3943  // Do not upgrade versions to any version between HD_SPLIT and FEATURE_PRE_SPLIT_KEYPOOL unless already supporting HD_SPLIT
3944  int max_version = walletInstance->nWalletVersion;
3945  if (!walletInstance->CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT) && max_version >=FEATURE_HD_SPLIT && max_version < FEATURE_PRE_SPLIT_KEYPOOL) {
3946  InitError(_("Cannot upgrade a non HD split wallet without upgrading to support pre split keypool. Please use -upgradewallet=169900 or -upgradewallet with no version specified."));
3947  return nullptr;
3948  }
3949 
3950  bool hd_upgrade = false;
3951  bool split_upgrade = false;
3952  if (walletInstance->CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD) && !walletInstance->IsHDEnabled()) {
3953  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Upgrading wallet to HD\n");
3954  walletInstance->SetMinVersion(FEATURE_HD);
3955 
3956  // generate a new master key
3957  CPubKey masterPubKey = walletInstance->GenerateNewSeed();
3958  walletInstance->SetHDSeed(masterPubKey);
3959  hd_upgrade = true;
3960  }
3961  // Upgrade to HD chain split if necessary
3962  if (walletInstance->CanSupportFeature(FEATURE_HD_SPLIT)) {
3963  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Upgrading wallet to use HD chain split\n");
3964  walletInstance->SetMinVersion(FEATURE_PRE_SPLIT_KEYPOOL);
3965  split_upgrade = FEATURE_HD_SPLIT > prev_version;
3966  }
3967  // Mark all keys currently in the keypool as pre-split
3968  if (split_upgrade) {
3969  walletInstance->MarkPreSplitKeys();
3970  }
3971  // Regenerate the keypool if upgraded to HD
3972  if (hd_upgrade) {
3973  if (!walletInstance->TopUpKeyPool()) {
3974  InitError(_("Unable to generate keys"));
3975  return nullptr;
3976  }
3977  }
3978  }
3979 
3980  if (fFirstRun)
3981  {
3982  // ensure this wallet.dat can only be opened by clients supporting HD with chain split and expects no default key
3983  walletInstance->SetMinVersion(FEATURE_LATEST);
3984 
3985  if ((wallet_creation_flags & WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
3986  //selective allow to set flags
3987  walletInstance->SetWalletFlag(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS);
3988  } else {
3989  // generate a new seed
3990  CPubKey seed = walletInstance->GenerateNewSeed();
3991  walletInstance->SetHDSeed(seed);
3992  }
3993 
3994  // Top up the keypool
3995  if (!walletInstance->IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS) && !walletInstance->TopUpKeyPool()) {
3996  InitError(_("Unable to generate initial keys"));
3997  return nullptr;
3998  }
3999 
4000  auto locked_chain = chain.assumeLocked(); // Temporary. Removed in upcoming lock cleanup
4001  walletInstance->ChainStateFlushed(chainActive.GetLocator());
4002  } else if (wallet_creation_flags & WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS) {
4003  // Make it impossible to disable private keys after creation
4004  InitError(strprintf(_("Error loading %s: Private keys can only be disabled during creation"), walletFile));
4005  return NULL;
4006  } else if (walletInstance->IsWalletFlagSet(WALLET_FLAG_DISABLE_PRIVATE_KEYS)) {
4007  LOCK(walletInstance->cs_KeyStore);
4008  if (!walletInstance->mapKeys.empty() || !walletInstance->mapCryptedKeys.empty()) {
4009  InitWarning(strprintf(_("Warning: Private keys detected in wallet {%s} with disabled private keys"), walletFile));
4010  }
4011  }
4012 
4013  if (!gArgs.GetArg("-addresstype", "").empty() && !ParseOutputType(gArgs.GetArg("-addresstype", ""), walletInstance->m_default_address_type)) {
4014  InitError(strprintf("Unknown address type '%s'", gArgs.GetArg("-addresstype", "")));
4015  return nullptr;
4016  }
4017 
4018  if (!gArgs.GetArg("-changetype", "").empty() && !ParseOutputType(gArgs.GetArg("-changetype", ""), walletInstance->m_default_change_type)) {
4019  InitError(strprintf("Unknown change type '%s'", gArgs.GetArg("-changetype", "")));
4020  return nullptr;
4021  }
4022 
4023  if (gArgs.IsArgSet("-mintxfee")) {
4024  CAmount n = 0;
4025  if (!ParseMoney(gArgs.GetArg("-mintxfee", ""), n) || 0 == n) {
4026  InitError(AmountErrMsg("mintxfee", gArgs.GetArg("-mintxfee", "")));
4027  return nullptr;
4028  }
4029  if (n > HIGH_TX_FEE_PER_KB) {
4030  InitWarning(AmountHighWarn("-mintxfee") + " " +
4031  _("This is the minimum transaction fee you pay on every transaction."));
4032  }
4033  walletInstance->m_min_fee = CFeeRate(n);
4034  }
4035 
4036  walletInstance->m_allow_fallback_fee = Params().IsFallbackFeeEnabled();
4037  if (gArgs.IsArgSet("-fallbackfee")) {
4038  CAmount nFeePerK = 0;
4039  if (!ParseMoney(gArgs.GetArg("-fallbackfee", ""), nFeePerK)) {
4040  InitError(strprintf(_("Invalid amount for -fallbackfee=<amount>: '%s'"), gArgs.GetArg("-fallbackfee", "")));
4041  return nullptr;
4042  }
4043  if (nFeePerK > HIGH_TX_FEE_PER_KB) {
4044  InitWarning(AmountHighWarn("-fallbackfee") + " " +
4045  _("This is the transaction fee you may pay when fee estimates are not available."));
4046  }
4047  walletInstance->m_fallback_fee = CFeeRate(nFeePerK);
4048  walletInstance->m_allow_fallback_fee = nFeePerK != 0; //disable fallback fee in case value was set to 0, enable if non-null value
4049  }
4050  if (gArgs.IsArgSet("-discardfee")) {
4051  CAmount nFeePerK = 0;
4052  if (!ParseMoney(gArgs.GetArg("-discardfee", ""), nFeePerK)) {
4053  InitError(strprintf(_("Invalid amount for -discardfee=<amount>: '%s'"), gArgs.GetArg("-discardfee", "")));
4054  return nullptr;
4055  }
4056  if (nFeePerK > HIGH_TX_FEE_PER_KB) {
4057  InitWarning(AmountHighWarn("-discardfee") + " " +
4058  _("This is the transaction fee you may discard if change is smaller than dust at this level"));
4059  }
4060  walletInstance->m_discard_rate = CFeeRate(nFeePerK);
4061  }
4062  if (gArgs.IsArgSet("-paytxfee")) {
4063  CAmount nFeePerK = 0;
4064  if (!ParseMoney(gArgs.GetArg("-paytxfee", ""), nFeePerK)) {
4065  InitError(AmountErrMsg("paytxfee", gArgs.GetArg("-paytxfee", "")));
4066  return nullptr;
4067  }
4068  if (nFeePerK > HIGH_TX_FEE_PER_KB) {
4069  InitWarning(AmountHighWarn("-paytxfee") + " " +
4070  _("This is the transaction fee you will pay if you send a transaction."));
4071  }
4072  walletInstance->m_pay_tx_fee = CFeeRate(nFeePerK, 1000);
4073  if (walletInstance->m_pay_tx_fee < ::minRelayTxFee) {
4074  InitError(strprintf(_("Invalid amount for -paytxfee=<amount>: '%s' (must be at least %s)"),
4075  gArgs.GetArg("-paytxfee", ""), ::minRelayTxFee.ToString()));
4076  return nullptr;
4077  }
4078  }
4079  walletInstance->m_confirm_target = gArgs.GetArg("-txconfirmtarget", DEFAULT_TX_CONFIRM_TARGET);
4080  walletInstance->m_spend_zero_conf_change = gArgs.GetBoolArg("-spendzeroconfchange", DEFAULT_SPEND_ZEROCONF_CHANGE);
4081  walletInstance->m_signal_rbf = gArgs.GetBoolArg("-walletrbf", DEFAULT_WALLET_RBF);
4082 
4083  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Wallet completed loading in %15dms\n", GetTimeMillis() - nStart);
4084 
4085  // Try to top up keypool. No-op if the wallet is locked.
4086  walletInstance->TopUpKeyPool();
4087 
4088  LockAnnotation lock(::cs_main); // Temporary, for FindForkInGlobalIndex below. Removed in upcoming commit.
4089  auto locked_chain = chain.lock();
4090  LOCK(walletInstance->cs_wallet);
4091 
4092  CBlockIndex *pindexRescan = chainActive.Genesis();
4093  if (!gArgs.GetBoolArg("-rescan", false))
4094  {
4095  WalletBatch batch(*walletInstance->database);
4096  CBlockLocator locator;
4097  if (batch.ReadBestBlock(locator))
4098  pindexRescan = FindForkInGlobalIndex(chainActive, locator);
4099  }
4100 
4101  walletInstance->m_last_block_processed = chainActive.Tip();
4102 
4103  if (chainActive.Tip() && chainActive.Tip() != pindexRescan)
4104  {
4105  //We can't rescan beyond non-pruned blocks, stop and throw an error
4106  //this might happen if a user uses an old wallet within a pruned node
4107  // or if he ran -disablewallet for a longer time, then decided to re-enable
4108  if (fPruneMode)
4109  {
4110  CBlockIndex *block = chainActive.Tip();
4111  while (block && block->pprev && (block->pprev->nStatus & BLOCK_HAVE_DATA) && block->pprev->nTx > 0 && pindexRescan != block)
4112  block = block->pprev;
4113 
4114  if (pindexRescan != block) {
4115  InitError(_("Prune: last wallet synchronisation goes beyond pruned data. You need to -reindex (download the whole blockchain again in case of pruned node)"));
4116  return nullptr;
4117  }
4118  }
4119 
4120  uiInterface.InitMessage(_("Rescanning..."));
4121  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Rescanning last %i blocks (from block %i)...\n", chainActive.Height() - pindexRescan->nHeight, pindexRescan->nHeight);
4122 
4123  // No need to read and scan block if block was created before
4124  // our wallet birthday (as adjusted for block time variability)
4125  while (pindexRescan && walletInstance->nTimeFirstKey && (pindexRescan->GetBlockTime() < (walletInstance->nTimeFirstKey - TIMESTAMP_WINDOW))) {
4126  pindexRescan = chainActive.Next(pindexRescan);
4127  }
4128 
4129  nStart = GetTimeMillis();
4130  {
4131  WalletRescanReserver reserver(walletInstance.get());
4132  const CBlockIndex *stop_block, *failed_block;
4133  if (!reserver.reserve() || (ScanResult::SUCCESS != walletInstance->ScanForWalletTransactions(pindexRescan, nullptr, reserver, failed_block, stop_block, true))) {
4134  InitError(_("Failed to rescan the wallet during initialization"));
4135  return nullptr;
4136  }
4137  }
4138  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("Rescan completed in %15dms\n", GetTimeMillis() - nStart);
4139  walletInstance->ChainStateFlushed(chainActive.GetLocator());
4140  walletInstance->database->IncrementUpdateCounter();
4141 
4142  // Restore wallet transaction metadata after -zapwallettxes=1
4143  if (gArgs.GetBoolArg("-zapwallettxes", false) && gArgs.GetArg("-zapwallettxes", "1") != "2")
4144  {
4145  WalletBatch batch(*walletInstance->database);
4146 
4147  for (const CWalletTx& wtxOld : vWtx)
4148  {
4149  uint256 hash = wtxOld.GetHash();
4150  std::map<uint256, CWalletTx>::iterator mi = walletInstance->mapWallet.find(hash);
4151  if (mi != walletInstance->mapWallet.end())
4152  {
4153  const CWalletTx* copyFrom = &wtxOld;
4154  CWalletTx* copyTo = &mi->second;
4155  copyTo->mapValue = copyFrom->mapValue;
4156  copyTo->vOrderForm = copyFrom->vOrderForm;
4157  copyTo->nTimeReceived = copyFrom->nTimeReceived;
4158  copyTo->nTimeSmart = copyFrom->nTimeSmart;
4159  copyTo->fFromMe = copyFrom->fFromMe;
4160  copyTo->nOrderPos = copyFrom->nOrderPos;
4161  batch.WriteTx(*copyTo);
4162  }
4163  }
4164  }
4165  }
4166 
4167  uiInterface.LoadWallet(walletInstance);
4168 
4169  // Register with the validation interface. It's ok to do this after rescan since we're still holding cs_main.
4170  RegisterValidationInterface(walletInstance.get());
4171 
4172  walletInstance->SetBroadcastTransactions(gArgs.GetBoolArg("-walletbroadcast", DEFAULT_WALLETBROADCAST));
4173 
4174  {
4175  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("setKeyPool.size() = %u\n", walletInstance->GetKeyPoolSize());
4176  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("mapWallet.size() = %u\n", walletInstance->mapWallet.size());
4177  walletInstance->WalletLogPrintf("mapAddressBook.size() = %u\n", walletInstance->mapAddressBook.size());
4178  }
4179 
4180  return walletInstance;
4181 }

4225 int CMerkleTx::GetDepthInMainChain(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain) const
4226 {
4227  if (hashUnset())
4228  return 0;
4229 
4230  AssertLockHeld(cs_main);
4231 
4232  // Find the block it claims to be in
4233  CBlockIndex* pindex = LookupBlockIndex(hashBlock);
4234  if (!pindex || !chainActive.Contains(pindex))
4235  return 0;
4236 
4237  return ((nIndex == -1) ? (-1) : 1) * (chainActive.Height() - pindex->nHeight + 1);
4238 }

4240 int CMerkleTx::GetBlocksToMaturity(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain) const
4241 {
4242  if (!IsCoinBase())
4243  return 0;
4244  int chain_depth = GetDepthInMainChain(locked_chain);
4245  assert(chain_depth >= 0); // coinbase tx should not be conflicted
4246  return std::max(0, (COINBASE_MATURITY+1) - chain_depth);
4247 }

4255 bool CWalletTx::AcceptToMemoryPool(interfaces::Chain::Lock& locked_chain, const CAmount& nAbsurdFee, CValidationState& state)
4256 {
4257  LockAnnotation lock(::cs_main); // Temporary, for AcceptToMemoryPool below. Removed in upcoming commit.
4258 
4259  // We must set fInMempool here - while it will be re-set to true by the
4260  // entered-mempool callback, if we did not there would be a race where a
4261  // user could call sendmoney in a loop and hit spurious out of funds errors
4262  // because we think that this newly generated transaction's change is
4263  // unavailable as we're not yet aware that it is in the mempool.
4264  bool ret = ::AcceptToMemoryPool(mempool, state, tx, nullptr /* pfMissingInputs */,
4265  nullptr /* plTxnReplaced */, false /* bypass_limits */, nAbsurdFee);
4266  fInMempool |= ret;
4267  return ret;
4268 }

4287 std::vector<OutputGroup> CWallet::GroupOutputs(const std::vector<COutput>& outputs, bool single_coin) const {
4288  std::vector<OutputGroup> groups;
4289  std::map<CTxDestination, OutputGroup> gmap;
4290  CTxDestination dst;
4291  for (const auto& output : outputs) {
4292  if (output.fSpendable) {
4293  CInputCoin input_coin = output.GetInputCoin();
4294 
4295  size_t ancestors, descendants;
4296  mempool.GetTransactionAncestry(output.tx->GetHash(), ancestors, descendants);
4297  if (!single_coin && ExtractDestination(output.tx->tx->vout[output.i].scriptPubKey, dst)) {
4298  // Limit output groups to no more than 10 entries, to protect
4299  // against inadvertently creating a too-large transaction
4300  // when using -avoidpartialspends
4301  if (gmap[dst].m_outputs.size() >= OUTPUT_GROUP_MAX_ENTRIES) {
4302  groups.push_back(gmap[dst]);
4303  gmap.erase(dst);
4304  }
4305  gmap[dst].Insert(input_coin, output.nDepth, output.tx->IsFromMe(ISMINE_ALL), ancestors, descendants);
4306  } else {
4307  groups.emplace_back(input_coin, output.nDepth, output.tx->IsFromMe(ISMINE_ALL), ancestors, descendants);
4308  }
4309  }
4310  }
4311  if (!single_coin) {
4312  for (const auto& it : gmap) groups.push_back(it.second);
4313  }
4314  return groups;
4315 }
4316 
4317 bool CWallet::GetKeyOrigin(const CKeyID& keyID, KeyOriginInfo& info) const
4318 {
4319  CKeyMetadata meta;
4320  {
4321  LOCK(cs_wallet);
4322  auto it = mapKeyMetadata.find(keyID);
4323  if (it != mapKeyMetadata.end()) {
4324  meta = it->second;
4325  }
4326  }
4327  if (!meta.hdKeypath.empty()) {
4328  if (!ParseHDKeypath(meta.hdKeypath, info.path)) return false;
4329  // Get the proper master key id
4330  CKey key;
4331  GetKey(meta.hd_seed_id, key);
4332  CExtKey masterKey;
4333  masterKey.SetSeed(key.begin(), key.size());
4334  // Compute identifier
4335  CKeyID masterid = masterKey.key.GetPubKey().GetID();
4336  std::copy(masterid.begin(), masterid.begin() + 4, info.fingerprint);
4337  } else { // Single pubkeys get the master fingerprint of themselves
4338  std::copy(keyID.begin(), keyID.begin() + 4, info.fingerprint);
4339  }
4340  return true;
4341 }
